Terrible food! I had eggs Benedict and my eggs were hard boiled. Sent the dish back, they brought my same food back!! How gross can you be? My sauce and ham and muffin were freezing cold.

So glad they were able to reopen! Very beautiful interior. High ceilings, awesome character to the building that makes me wonder what it used to be. Dog friendly! My pooch loved it. The outdoor area is enclosed and has a nice grassy area. They were playing movies on the wall some weekends before, that was very cool. They have a shelf of fun games to play too. The beers are really good, very malt-forward and refreshing.

For my Two Hundredth review I give "The Block".  Cute name cute inside cute little meat case with cute little chunks of meat.  The service was not so cute.  The server wished she was anywhere but here waiting on us.  I feel your pain it is hard to work for a living.  But if you are not a people person than maybe you need to sit in a cube somewhere and not waiting on people with your lousy attitude and pathetically slow to non existent service.  What saves this place from something less than 3 stars is the food was very good.  I had their steak sandwich..  It was very good.  Odd instead of one slice of steak it was pieces of steak placed on the bread.  I almost felt it was leftovers from the butcher shop.  But style or not the steak was very good.  It had a nice punch to it from the pepper they seasoned it with and the gardinaire it was served with.  The steak sandwich came with fries so I asked for some ketchup.  It came out in one of those little stainless steel cups that was about 25% full.  So after about 2 fries I needed more.  Good luck with that.  Refer to server section of the review. 

My son The Famous Chip K. was with me anid told me he had this server before and she was bad.  Oh well.  So go for the food not the service.  Really it is cute in a cute way

The 5 stars are for the Tech, Aaron who made a home visit. 
The communications and follow through of the headquarters was most unsatisfactory! (only 1*at best. The lack of customer service and follow through was unacceptable. Only received satisfactory help after speaking with a supervisor. They need to step up their game

Since our experience was brunch, not the hotel itself, I hesitated to write this review. However, after reading the reviews of others, I feel our experience represents what others have said & felt so here goes. 

Christmas brunch: $75. We had no reservations & can now see why they weren't booked up.

Only soups were a gumbo & squash. Soup was tepid, soup "bar" messy. There was a large bread bar & I found a good yeasty roll. The gumbo was full of shrimp, sausage. (Later the waitress told me she could heat anything. That's nice but shouldn't be necessary.) The staff seemed overworked (we were initially led to the wrong table -- people were EATING there), but by & large tried really hard to accommodate. $75 included unlimited mimosas & my glass was never wanting. 

It's hard to explain the worn, tired, outdated, rather unkept appearance. Like where we were finally seated along the wall, there were bumps in the carpet from electrical or whatever, but dust had accumulated. I even made the comment that I smelled moth balls. Hubby pointed to the, rather outdated in my opinion, cloth decorations on the tables/buffets. Made sense to me. 

Hubby was delighted w/ the fresh oysters. Also the shrimp and crawfish. His omelette looked appetizing. Most desserts were to die for! The pralines were tasty but grainy and I've had better macaroons. My egg on artichoke was not properly cooked. The broccoli was hard, and too garlicky as was the cornbread stuffing. 

Pictures are worth. . .

I am so sorry to say that I was disappointed.... We went in after a doctor appointment at the Penn center and bought a reeces peanut butter cheesecake.....I am sorry but it tastes like it was on display for a while...not fresh nor creamy...I'm sorry to the owners but it really was not good...

Worse than Dealing with the Cable Company!!! 

The window given was 12- 4pm... It is after 4 and yet I am still sitting here. I had to use Vacation Time to wait for the carpet cleaners. I have called the office and was told both times they are 5 minutes away... it has not yet been true.  The 3 room special Is not worth it- pay a little extra for a local company that gives an appointment time and provides some customer service.  

At least if Comcast is past their appointment time the give you $25 as this is the end of their day I am sure the job will be rushed and they will be tired so the quality of my job will be reduced.  

They DID NOT move the furniture little night stands, a table with wheels...they cleaned around it.... 

NEVER WILL I USE THEM AGAIN.

We always enjoy eating at Pacific Counter especially in these difficult times.  Thank you for being open and continuing to serve the community. We really appreciate you. The food is always great. The rice bowls are huge and have great ingredients....and you must get the Dole Whip!!!

Car was brought in for a few issues.  They did nothing and charged me.  Tried to negotiate with them and the girl at the counter was rude!  They also gave me a list of items that needed repair.  Went to another car mechanic and told me that I did not need what they suggested.  Whole experience was a nightmare!

While the food is ok, I CANNOT in good conscience eat somewhere that STEALS their delivery drivers tips. I ordered  through grub hub, and they charge a 5$ dekivery fee and then STOLE my tip to the driver that you can add to your order online. GRUBHUB even says that tip line is meant for the driver.

No matter how good the food is, I cannot think of ever handing my money over to theives who treat their employees like shit.
I eat at the Oregon Diner several times a month. It ls by far, the best diner in the area! Their menu offers a large variety and they bake their own goods on the premises.

I paid a visit to the salon over the weekend because my teenage daughter gets her nails done there frequently. I was pleasantly surprised with the salon. The staff and services were excellent!!! Juliettes has gained a new client.

Good food. Nice open atmosphere. We had a larger group for a late lunch and everyone was pleased with their order. I had the bacon cheese burger with fries and was quite pleased. The server was attentive to our large group and we didn't have to wait an unreasonable amount of time.

My husband and I normally go to the California Pizza Kitchen in MD but decided to venture to DE to do something different.  We always sit at the bar.  Today when we got to the bar this gentleman was busy pouring his friends drinks and wondering where the party was later that evening.  He didn't even approach us until 5 minutes later but when he did he felt irritated because he had to leave his conversation with his friends. He took our order but when our salads came out he didn't offer any cracked pepper or napkins.  I suggest to this location retrain your bartenders.

Loved my food, service, atmosphere there and drinks. Everything was great and fairly priced. I got wild berry crepes special and my friend got steak Benedict that he didn't like at all. 
The only thing I was shocked with is that bacon was   Hatfield paper thin bacon for $6. 
Service was extremely fast and accurate. 
I will definitely come back.

CLOSED.    I loved this place.  They are pulling out of all Nashville area locations.  
So sad.

The absolute best Fish Tacos!! I moved to Tucson in July from the East Coast and was worried I would not find good Fish Tacos, I was definitely wrong! They have the best taste and the perfect mix of spices, not too spicy, but perfect. Thank you!

This is a great little spot in Trolly Square. I go here for take out lunch when in the area. Food is delicious and servers are pleasant. A wonderful place to go for pricy night out in a contemporary atmosphere.
The fried chicken was not dry at all. Actually taste a good level of spice. Side of fries super crispy which I love. Also love the bubble tea. Tapioca actually chewy. Would definitely come again.

Food 10/10
Service 6/10
Crepes 10/10
Coffee 10/10
Chicken 9/10
Potatoes 10/10

Ha. Hope this makes sense.

Really great French onion soup, really good prime rib French dip, really crappy service, under cooked fish, and long wait times, on a Tuesday night!
Had to flag our server down, every time, and then wait at length for responses. 
When fish was extremely undercooked server took to manger who then offered to re-cook even though at that point we didn't even want it, waited 45 minutes again, for the next plate, didn't even bother to add discount or adjust bill. Heck the manager didn't even come out at all. Totally not worth it, and FYI much older crowd this restaurant is definitely aging, no wonder no one I know comes here any more. Sad.

This place is a god send for all of tampa, hands down by far the best pizza you can get in temple terrace. I spent 20 bucks in here and got a beautiful pie. I made the mistake of opening the box in the car on the way home, and man let me tell you the symphony of aromas that filled my car was engulfing.  almost hit the curb because I was blinded by the reflection of the sun when it hit that cheese shine. I'm so lucky to be soo close to this place I'll be back don't worry.I'm stuffed and I still want another slice just to put the taste in my mouth
First time getting Hachi tonight and we truly enjoyed it. I had the crab croquettes as an appetizer and they were so delicious, the rolls also tasted fresh and yummy. Can't wait to go back!

GO DIGGS!!! ALL I CAN SAY IS WOW! This place is AMAZING! Very generous with the toppings. Super fast delivery and an excellent staff! We have only ordered twice but the fact we came back is an A++++ in my book! We love trying new places but every time I think pizza I'm comparing everyone to you.
Super nice guys here. They'll admit if you could wait another month for an oil change. Always go out of their way. Always friendly.

Best in the town ... I tried Rum Raisin and it was delish .. my kids gobbled up their chocolate cones .. next time I MUST try Mexican Hot Chocolate that has cinnamon and cayenne.. great people served it with a beautiful smile .. Loved it 100%

5 stars for the Gibraltar Roast- A Seasonal Espresso Blend- Syrupy, Sweet, & Well Balanced.

Our friends brought us some coffee beans from one of their favorite coffee shops in Santa Barbara.  Somehow we managed to polish off  a 12 oz bag in less than a week...it was SO smooth and rich,  just as the description says on the bag, it was syrupy, sweet and well balanced. We were whipping up  Americano's, Iced Lattes, espresso, you name it, but the fun ended almost as soon as it began.

I am looking forward to visit Handlebar next time I'm in Santa Barbara!

We stopped by for lunch on Saturday. Our server was very helpful in describing the foods, which we were unfamilar with. Although it was very crowded, like all the restaurants in the French Quarter at noon, we got a table and good service. She didn't rush us, and it did not take too long to get our food. Unlike some of the comments below stating it was over priced, I found that to be the furthest from the truth. Seems to be everything was $12. The Po-Boys were HUGE! I shared one with my sister, and we could not finish it. My other sister ordered red beans and rice, which was very good, and another large portion, we all ended up sharing it. The burgers were also extremely large, at least 1/2 pound. The food was good, service was good, and they do not charge an automatic gratuity for 4 people. They have listed at the bottom of the bill a  gratuity calculation of 18% and 20% for your convenience. Perhaps it is for those people who stiff the server with a couple of bucks, or for people who cannot figure out what 20% of the cost is. I would recommend this restaurant.

Had lunch here a couple of days ago just to give it another try after months of walking past it on my way to lunch.
I really want to like this place because it's a neat place; decor, layout, location, outside seating.  
We checked them out when they first opened but we haven't been back since because we weren't impressed.  Maybe we just ordered the wrong items on the menu.
This time, I ordered shrimp quesadilla....salty and cheesy and greasy...The fries were good though.
Maybe I'll give it another try months from now.

I ate here for the first time when I visited Philly a couple weeks ago. It was my first BYOB experience and that was AWESOME! It's a really busy/crowded restaurant and we went for Brunch so there was no exception. Luckily my friend was able to call ahead to put our name in for a party of seven. We could track our spot on the waiting list through their text messaging system which was definitely convenient. By the time we made it to the restaurant there was only one party ahead of us. However, we still ended up waiting at least 45 minutes because it seems that there is limited seating for larger groups. 

When we finally got our table we immediately took our bottles out ready to get our drank on! The waitress opened our champagne bottle for us in the back and we ordered a couple juices to go with it. We also brought vodka, which went great with their delicious bloody mary mix. 

For brunch, they had a TON of veggie options which was amazing!! The variety was great! They also have a "Specials" Menu which had the potential to be really cool, but it seems like it's just the same specials and regular recipes that they usually make where they just change the names of the items to a new theme. The food still looked pretty good though. 

I ordered the Ultimate Mexi Scramble. I was really excited about this dish as the description made it look delicious. I really enjoyed the black bean grits that came with the dish. The scramble itself was pretty good, but also a little bit too liquidy. The portion of food was large which was great because we were all starving after having waited to get a table for so long. The rest of my friends at the table seemed to really enjoy their food. 

I enjoyed my experience at Sabrina's Cafe for the most part. I really liked the BYOB policy. the food wasn't AMAZING in my opinion, but it was still pretty darn good. The only thing that was frustrating was the wait to actually get a table. It may be worth it for the restaurant to consider taking reservations for parties larger than 6.
Excellent restaurant.  Lots of regulars and great service.  Had the chefs choice of tapa and they were so good!  Will go back if given the opportunity!

Have been shopping at Cadence for several years now and have had nothing but tremendous experiences. From high end racing bikes to bikes for my kids, they have given us great advice and attention. And the mechanical services are top notch too. I couldn't imagine shopping at a different shop. They are a tremendous asset to the Philly cycling community.
I love this coffee shop! I've been a customer since it opened! The staff is so friendly and helpful.

I grew up in a Polish household,  I miss my mother's and BIabcia's meals.  I was looking forward to trying the meals at Pat's Polish Deli.  The store/restaurant is clean and well organized.  The personnel friendly and helpful.    We chose three meals, pierogi, stuffed cabbage and hunter stew,  all delicious.  We will be coming back again and again.
Mediocre quality food and service. They can do much better with the quality with a teeny bit off effort

One of my fav go to asian restaurants. Food is always ready fast. Place looks clean. Food are ok, I would give 3.5 stars, 0.5 for the milk tea/service. We order takeaway most of the time now due to covid-19, still not used to dine-in yet.

Family Pak & Ship did an outstanding job packing several boxes of art pottery and dishes for me.  Everything arrived unbroken and in great shape.  I would gladly use them again and highly recommend them to others. Robert U.

Well I got my legs done on the previous Saturday and everything was good, went back for a full face Waxing, by the evening I was covered in Hives, no one advised me of this possible reaction and no pre care or after care advice was given.
I called and it was two days later before I got a call from the Manager, no compensation was offered.
Will not be going back.

Let me start off by saying I loved it here and cannot wait to return! With that out of the way, went to brunch -- there was mimosas! The end! LOL!

Of course, I wanted the mimosa tower for $69 (it's better for maybe 3 or more people). It was just my friend and I. She met me here (drove over an hour to Philly). We opted for the bottle of champagne w/ OJ $35. I got a shot of peach flavor to go with my mimosa. I enjoyed every drop and loved mixing in the OJ, champagne and peach! On point...delicious. 
Buzzzzzed! I ordered the hangover tots!!! I did not know I wanted this in my life! I loved this yummy,  hot mess, of a concoction! Friend is vegan and she enjoyed her meal too!

Made reservations several days in advance for Sunday brunch on OpenTable. Outdoor seating was the only spots available (at the time)-- I snagged it! The reservations are a hot commodity I see. We were both running a bit late. There's a little bit of a grace period and the employees here were very accommodating to our delay. Customer service was good too!

Love...this...spot...for...BRUNCH!

This was my first trip on Hubbard's Marina excursions, and I have to say it was probably one of the best put together outings that I've had (12-hour overnight Snapper) ever on a charter boat. Captain Bobby first mate Mike in additional deckhand "Scrap" were outstanding. They were very professional & upbeat, not a grumpy group of ole Salts that you typically run into on party boats, these folks really had it together.

The entire process was very A to B, which is good. I reached out to the artist JD who ended up doing my tattoo and he got it right! He understood what I wanted, did it, and we had a nice chat all the while. Thank you guys I'll definitely be back next time I have something in mind!

EL DORADO FURNITURE
St. Petersburg Fl. 

"Great Furniture store!

The moment you enter you feel at home. Quality products, friendly service, and excellent displays

Our salesperson  Miss. Jarlie 
was amazing She demonstrated excellent  professionalism You should be proud as to how well she represented your company. I recommende  100%because she is "Truly the best"

We had a fantastic experience. 

Great staff  

Mr. Vctor  Toro and Msr.Yarelis Davila

I would like to begin and say that everyone that I've encountered at The Length Bar has been extremely professional.

Each time that I've had an appointment scheduled, I have NEVER had to wait for my stylist to be ready.  I have always been placed in a chair immediately. 

My hair typically gets very oily after only a few days after getting it done professionally. I didn't know what to do. In the past, I always felt like getting a wash and press was a waste of money. After speaking with my stylist, we tried one of the product lines the salon sells called Love. This product works, it's AMAZING and smells great too. I've even bought the shampoo and conditioner for my home use too. 

I say all of this to say, the salon delivers a great customer experience.

Our stay was from Friday to Sunday, we checked in about 8 pm on Friday & Peter was amazing. He was very helpful, he let us chose what floor we would like. On Saturday, we shuttled to Busch Gardens at about 10 am, which was less than 5 mins away. LOVED THAT! When we chose to leave the park around 6 pm, we called the hotel & the shuttle was there in less than 5 mins, very efficient! The hotel has grab and go breakfast due to COVID. Housekeeping only comes into the room to replace trash bags, we had all our trash in bags & they didn't take those, but no big deal. The kids enjoyed the pool, the hotel has a limit of 10 people in the pool area, due to COVID. 
Our only dislike was that there was some kind of error in the system & it charged my card even night for a random amount. I hope they get that fixed because that could really ruin someone's trip. Thank you for our mini-vacation! We will be returning.

This is fast food no doubt, but I'll have to say the food is as good as any of the Italian franchises without the price.  Salads were cold and crispy, servings were generous with lots of meat.  Their hot breadsticks are to die for!  The store we visited was almost empty inside, but the drive through was loaded up.  The inside was spotless with every other table marked off for distance.  Lots of disinfectant being used on tables.  This is perfect takeout for a real meal, instead of a burger.  Hubby had a slice of pizza as his side and the crust was great.  I took it away from him when he said he had more food than he could eat!
Order a skillet, kids pancake, and breakfast burrito for delivery. Food was delicious and delivered with great quality. Will order again. :)

Food really went down hill, the last 3 meals I had were horrible :( It was so good before....I don't know what happened to this place... Won't be back or buy gift certificates for anyone anymore. I gave this review 3 stars because the server was fantastic!! Her name was Cori.. Otherwise I would of gave them 0 Stars.

Fabulous food, amazing drinks and friendly staff.  A very pleasant dinning dining experience for families, couples or when you are dining alone. 
Call ahead to reserve a table.

Ordered from this deli tonight on GrubHub. I'm from Philly, house sitting for my parents, and wanted to order something that felt like South Jersey to me. So, naturally, I get a hoagie. It was an arduous process deciding where to order from because I absolutely hate driving and delivery was a must. This spot had two great reviews for Indian food which sounded interesting to me, so I gave them a try.

I ordered the American cold hoagie combo with chips and a soda and a 2pc samosa. I really didn't need all that food just for myself, but after seeing the reviews about indian food, I felt a little obligated to try something other than the sandwich. I received a call from a friendly woman after placing my order that they were out of chips and the soda I requested, so she was able to substitute fries and a different soda. She also asked how I wanted the hoagie - apparently if you order without specifying, it's literally just bread, meat, and cheese! Good to know. I told her to load it up with lettuce, onion, tomato, and extra mayo.

The food came much faster than grubhub estimated. I had indicated contactless pickup, but the delivery guy still came to the door and waited for me to answer to hand off the food. He was super friendly as well, so I didn't mind. I just felt bad that I hadn't grabbed a mask before answering the door because I thought he would have put the food down and stepped away. I'm really not used to people being so friendly, haha. Philly is the city of brotherly love and all, but we are antisocial and don't like to make eye contact. This was different. 

The samosas were delicious. I've never had one before so I didn't have any expectations. The green sauce smelled spicy so I used the brown sauce for dipping and I think there was cinnamon in there? I liked the crunch. It was like an Indian perogi with tons of flavor.

The hoagie was okay! Not the best hoagie I have ever had in my life, but certainly not the worst and still better than wawa. I added more mayo from my fridge. It just didn't taste like it was made with the same love as the samosas, or maybe I was so impressed with the samosas that the hoagie seemed bland? Hmm.

The fries were perfect. Super crisp and crunchy on the outside, but soft on the inside. Absolutely perfect fries for my taste.

I was super full after eating everything but half the sandwich, but I am satisfied. I would definitely recommend this spot and/or try some more indian dishes if I am ever in the area with a hankering again.

What a wonderful place! I absolutely love the style of most of the clothing, shoes, and accessories in this store, and the customer service is just wonderful. The salespeople aren't intrusive, but they're always close by if you need them. They're all very helpful and knowledgeable,  and they're all really good at helping to find just the right item for the occasion. 

It's true that some of the clothing is very pricey, but those are strictly luxury items, like top-of-the-line cashmere sweaters, beautifully crafted handbags, and the like. However, they have a LOT of terrific basics, casual clothing, and mix-and-match pieces that are very reasonably priced,  and their sale rack is a dream. They have a fantastic selection of shoes, belts, and handbags that I haven't seen anywhere else. The jewelry offerings look to be carefully curated, and there are very cute pieces in a wide range of prices. 

They also have a fine selection of books and greeting cards, and a fine selection of musical instruments, to boot. 

I don't live in Nashville, but I'm frequently here on business, and this shop will become a regular destination whenever I visit.

Easy to find and enough parking in the plaza. It has a good amount of choices for food but it's mainly seafood. So if you never been to Chickie's & Pete's and you're from out of state then you need to try the crab fries. They are the best fries in the city probably even the state just go and enjoy yourself.

Hidden gem!! Great, authentic Mexican food. Don't let the cheesy strip mall hinder you,(I was skeptical), but.. it was Packed! The service was terrific, even apologizing for the delay in the food, (which I didn't even think we were waiting that long). One of the "brothers " was opening the door for ppl in a downpour, asking tables (and us) if we needed anything. Great Customer service & food =&  .

Went at high noon on a workday before we headed to the airport. Waited 45 minutes for some of the very BEST BBQ we have ever had.
I had the 8 oz brisket sandwich, loaded tater tots and jambalaya. Brisket was tender, juicy, tasteful and plentiful. Tater tots were ok but the jambalaya was delicious!!
Wife had the smoked turkey sandwich that was very moist with a wonderful light smoked flavor.
Daughter-in-law had the pulled pork sandwich, loaded tater tots and beans. Very tasty pork! This coming from someone who has eaten plenty of pork of the past 20 years in NC. The beans, mixed variety, were seasoned nicely. Could have cooked them a few minutes longer though.
If you go at lunch expect to wait and share a bench table with other patrons. I do not recommend taking a toddler as there is no kids menu nor a place for them to sit.
We will be back the next time we are in St Louis!

Took the review down a star.

Beer: good variety but doesn't seem to have a good go-to stand-out fall-back like other area breweries have. Not bad beer by any stretch of the imagination but more meh than memorable, unfortunately.

Service: this is a pet peeve of mine- if you're serving these beers, be proud & smart & able to answer questions about the brewing etc! I have yet to see this here. The young girls can answer basic questions w/ canned responses but go blank beyond that. We sat with empty glasses at the bar for uncomfortably long (they were not busy at all) and by the time she reached us, decided to get our check instead of another round. 

Food: not served, but menu from neighboring sushi place provided.

Stopped in the other day for some coffee with a friend.  Nothing spectacular stood out to me about this place.  I feel like it is trying too hard to be one of those hip coffee shops, but its not quite there.  Again, nothing terrible or fantastic about the place, just okay.  I ended up getting the iced Black Thunder coffee.  It was good, but I have had better iced coffee at other local places.  If I was in the area and needed a caffeine fix I would probably go back, but wont go out of my way to go here.

Stayed here 2 weeks ago for my 50th Bday! Booked off cheap hotels for $235.  Absolutely everything was superb!! The room, the view, but mostly the staff.  They set the experience apart.  TEN STARS!   Only suggestions ~do a little of your own homework and book things  yourself and save yourself more than a few dollars over using the concierge, but then....,,convenience costs:-).

This location is a little hard to get into due to the construction and general traffic around US-19 and Gulf to Bay. Its parking lot desperately needs to be repainted as there are parking spots on one side of the building that really isn't wide enough to hold parking plus the traffic of cars actually driving by.

The food is really good. I've had their chicken biscuit a number of times, and find it is better than many other fast food establishments. It is many times better than McDonald's and Burger King and is just as good, if not slightly better, than Chick-fil-A's.

Their hash browns are nicely seasoned, with some different herbs included, and are very good if they are fresh and hot. Once they've sat for more than a few minutes, they become soggy and unappetizing.

They have a huge variety of donuts and are constantly rotating different seasonal specials. The donuts are generally fresh although I've gotten a stale donut or two whenever I run by during the late evening.

The service is friendly, although it is slow! If I place an order inside, they will do three or four cars before finally handing me my order. I dislike that the emphasis is placed on people in the drive-thru, and wish they would have dedicated staff for both sides.

Great food, pricey, but because of the size  portions, you'll be having leftovers for at least one more meal. I ordered the prime rib and it literally was the size of the meat in the Flintstone's intro.

 Food is made to order, so there is a wait but definitely worth it. Puts any chain restaurant to shame.

I've taken my daughter here 4 times now. Twice for well check ups and twice for sickness. Every time I've waited in a room for an hour for the doctor. Yesterday I took my daughter in and got no answers. I was told to do an X-ray and 5 pages of bloodwork. My daughter is 2! I felt like the doctor was in a rush to get to her lunch break. I am concerned and she acted like we were just an inconvenience. She asked if my daughter was going to cry when she got close to her. What's it matter? You're a doctor and she's a kid? I will be finding a new doctor for my daughter.

I have to share an experience I had at Bros about 3 months ago. A little late I know. We had a group of about 12 people eating at bros on a busy night. The staff was overwhelmed. After ordering we all got our apps and a short time later everyone but me got their main course. The server returned after several minutes to check on us and I told her that I hadn't gotten my food. She apologized and went to check on it. A few minutes later the manager came by with a bowl of delicious meatballs and sauce. He apologized again and admitted that the order had been overlooked and gave me the meatballs to tide me over. Great! He then brought me my food (some wings if I remember correctly) in a to go box since everyone else was done eating and took the wings off the bill. He should teach a class on customer service. This is a way of doing things that simply doesn't exist anymore. Way more than I would expect for an understandable error on a busy night. Good food too.
This place is amazing!!! Our waitress Brooke is amazing! Very attentive and she definitely caters to her guest! Will be back again! Thank you again for such great service!!

They lie about your pick up timing . The two lady at the reception is so freaking slow . They said 20 mins on phone an now I come in after 30 mins n still say 15 to 20 mins and they don't even know the orders. Never gonna go there again . They should better change the two ladies at the counter . I wouldn't even rate 1 star .

I've heard coworkers talk about Thai place for months. Told my wife I wouldn't go without her. Went for a date lunch. Covid was in full swing so seating was limited but wasn't a problem. They serve what seems to be like big calzones. They're claim to fame were the "sauces on the side." They were pretty tasty! I'll stop by for lunch again. If I have to make a suggestion maybe providing a sampler of the sides to purchase with the ol meat pocket.

We came for dinner during the weekend. The atmosphere was nice. The food was delicious. I had chicken tikka masala, along with some garlic naan. They were both delicious. I can't remember the name of the other dish we ordered, but it was basically seasoned cauliflower, onions, and potatoes. The cauliflower dish was good, but not as seasoned and flavorful as in other Indian restaurants I've been to. We enjoyed everything overall. Our waitress was polite and helpful. We will definitely return. A lot of people appeared to also pickup takeout orders from the restaurant, so that's always an option if you don't want to dine in.

I am so happy this brewery opened up in this little town! I originally stumbled upon Westville to first go to Speranza. Then we stumbled upon Lorenzo's, and NOW we have this great brewery AND that cupcake shop!! The brewery is cute inside and has a nice outside area in the back when it's warmer out! The beer is very tasty and there is almost always a new fun beer to try! The owners are incredibly nice!
Beware! Do NOT recommend! Paid twice what I was expecting. Tried to work out with owner and they threatened to come and remove the pump that was installed.

This location has a very easy drive-thru (easy to navigate). However, it was pouring rain when my fiance and I ordered at the drive-thru. Because they did not have an awning or something to block the rain from coming down, I could BARELY hear the drive-thru operator through the speaker. I was straining super hard to hear (and my fiance is almost deaf in one ear so he DEFINITELY could not hear). 

We ordered the pretzel burger sandwich, 4 count of chicken nuggets with honey mustard, a medium Sprite, large fries, medium Diet Pepsi, 8 count of mozzarella sticks, and an order of chicken fries with barbecue sauce.

I see chicken tenders on the menu which is what my fiance wanted to order (although it said 2 count of chicken tenders but he wanted four) and the drive-thru operator said "Do you mean the nuggets? We don't have chicken tenders". And we were like "...No... the tenders..." and again she said that they didn't have those, so I was confused about that. (Unless she meant they didn't have any left in stock??) 

As for the parking lot: Once you collect your food from the drive-thru window, they only have parking spots available for handicap people to park, and you're only able to turn right out of the lot. If you wanted to eat in the parking lot, you'd have to basically do a square around the corner to come back into their parking lot again.

As for the food: My fiance liked the pretzel sandwich. They unfortunately did not give him any honey mustard like what he wanted for the chicken nuggets (so he ate those plain). I was pleasantly surprised to see how big a medium drink is (it's definitely like a large in my eyes!) I'm so used to diet drinks that it should taste fairly normal, but my Diet Pepsi tasted different this time, and not in a good way, I don't know... They forgot to give us marinara sauce (which is pictured in the promo for the sticks), so we ate them plain. Finally, my chicken fries were okay, they give more than what I was expecting in the box, but I just felt that they lacked flavor. They didn't taste like anything to be honest... I had a couple of my fiance's fries and those tasted good.

A small Mom and Pop shop, which are always a little more fresher and a little tastier than the big timers. This has to be one of the best sub sandwich places I have experienced in California. I live in Los Angeles so when I'm in Santa Barbara I always make it a must to come here. Must tries are the Turkey Breast and Tuna Melt subs, be sure to get the works.

I'm a bit of a fried chicken fanatic, so I was excited to try this place out. We went around lunch and got the 8 piece dark meal with mac and cheese. The chicken was a bit disappointing to me. The skin was not that crispy, and the chicken was pretty salty. However, the chicken was cooked perfectly, so I'll give them that. The mac and cheese was really good, I'd get that again. Overall, it's a decent fried chicken place, and it definitely beats KFC or Popeyes, but I wouldn't deem this the best fried chicken place in Indy.

Great place to play games with fiends! They have plenty of new games every time I visit! So whether you are looking to learn something new or go play your favorite game with friends it is a great place to hangout! The staff is super friendly and helpful and is always willing to teach and even play along side as you learn a new game! The drinks are wonderful and they have everything from beer to cool sodas!

I'm going to be a straight up tourist about this! This is Panera, what what?! Ok, so I didn't eat here, but I did go through the drive through. My friends got salads to go for the plane ride. They seemed to be very pleased with their orders from Saint Louis Break Co. / Panera. I can't believe I went here, Panera is blowing up everywhere... I've only been to one Panera in New York and I didn't think much of it.. but I still think it's cool that I got to visit here. If you have friends in town you should definitely take them here. Saint Louis pride. 

Fast service at the drive through! Great for a meal on the go.
Delicious burnt ends and deviled egg potato salad. Baked beans a little too sweet and bread a little too dry but I didn't eat it as a proper BBQ sandwhich.

This place was awesome, such an interesting and delicious array of ice creams! I got the goat cheese with cherries, and the brambleberry crumble, the combination was delicious! This was my first visit here, but what I really liked was that the servers didn't make you feel bad about asking for a sample of several different ice creams before making a decision. The flavors are so odd that you have to try them to fully appreciate their flavor. The only downside was the wait to get in, but the line moved fairly quickly, and once you get inside you understand the waiting (each person getting samples). 

Definitely will be going back when I'm in town, and I would highly suggest it to others!
First time at a dry cleaners and it was a very pleasant experience. My dresses look amazing. They were even able to fix a button on one of my dresses. Very fast & nice. Will be coming back again!

Loved it! I've been meaning to go here.  Their restaurant week menu/food was great! My drink was super.  Love the vibe in here so much.  I'm only not giving it five stars because our server not very personable in an "I'm just here to get paid" kind of way and was telling me about his ex, which was weird.

I started going to this salon about two years ago and first saw Kelly, who was fantastic with both my blonde highlights and knew how to cut hair perfectly.  I would honestly get a comment every time I left her chair!  I first started going here because I could schedule everything online (major bonus points) and I kept going because of the quick, efficient and excellent results.

I recently went back to the salon and saw Lori, who is new to this salon but who has done hair for years and was previously an instructor.  She was EXCELLENT.  She saw that I hadn't been to a salon in awhile and instantly knew how to fix my color.  I wanted to go a little more natural, after having gone a little too blonde at the last appointment.  She explained the process in the beginning, then as we went through the color and cut, she continued to explain what she was doing and why.  The result?  Best color I've had in... maybe ever.  She put on a glaze to help fix some of my highlights, which had faded, at no extra charge, too.  I highly recommend her to any girl with highlights, especially if one's is in need of some help/corrective color or wants a change to the status quo.

I love the street car. The operators are always lovely and were especially accommodating when we took some of our engagement photos on it during the Fringe festival last year (2012). Whether you're visiting the city or have lived here your entire life, it's definitely worth a ride at least once. The cars ooze history and charm (as do most of the operators), and I will continue taking a ride at least once a year.

Great little place in the French quarters. Walked in during peak hours and found a spot where they shuck oysters. Great place to sit as the gentlemen  working the oysters offered great service. I ended up getting the shrimp poboy which was delicious. Very flavorful and filling. The bonus for me was when they offered me a sample of the oysters, shrimp and sausage they had freshly cooked!! Now that was a pleasant surprise and I enjoyed the company. It was my first time in New Orleans and it definitely set the tone for the hospitality. Give it a shot if you are in the area!

Giving it a 3 because i could barely read the menu it got so dark. Anytime i have to pull out the cell phone is a problem.

the waitress was good enough.  nothing spectacular there, but she was friendly.  the food was good.  had the lemon rosemary chicken.  Very juicy and very flavorful.  the potatoes were a little undercooked though.  And possibly the chicken too. the next morning lets say i was not feeling to well.  I would have checked the chicken for doneness if, oh i don't know, if i could SEE!!  

The photos form the early 1900's of U.City were an awesome touch.  Loved those.  

All in all, i will try again.

Was a little disappointing because it was so small. About 1/2 the size of Johnny Cash's down stairs. Being a fan it was amazing to see her clothes and see the real history.  My favorite was her wedding albums and family pics.  If you love her go. But I don't think it was worth the price.

For a restaurant that I've walked out of once because of poor service, you may be surprised to hear that I like Champps a lot and go there regularly. Honestly I think it's more than just sports bar food as some have stated.  I actually like the nachos a lot whereas some seemed critical.  Some of the regular dinner dishes are very good too. Wings are very good.  Excellent beer selection.  A couple of the longer-term wait staff are really very good, friendly and engaging.  I agree that the host/hostess staff can be inattentive at times. There's also one particular female server there that is so disorganized that I can't have her serve us anymore.  Overall it's worth the chance of the infrequent mishap.

Awesome spot! The tour was fun and informative and the drinks were great. Very cool to see the behind the scenes and immediately be able to try their liquors after the tour. They have a wealth of knowledge about distilling and I'd highly recommend if you're looking for something fun, different, and exciting to do with 2 or 10 people.
Super friendly staff and good drinks why go to star bucks when you can support the local community 1 block down the road

This is not my regular Schnucks. However, whenever I am heading home from Costco and cutting down Loughborough to Hampton, I stop by for items I just cannot buy in bulk at the warehouse store for a single man. 

In my original review, which is now several years old, I complained about the produce department. Wow, things have really changed. I will now say this is one of the better produce departments in STL. It's always fresh, organized and well stocked.

I've also gotten use to the lay-out and can shop the aisles with ease. Another area that is pretty good, is the butcher counter. Give me those pork steaks for that backyard grilling. 

The staff has done a full Three-Sixty on their attitudes. Even during this pandemic when everyone seems to be on the edge, they were upbeat and positive.

While shopping during the COVID pandemic, I felt safe with all the safety precautions this store had in place. 

Will I return? - For, sure. 

When: June 4, 2020
Why: Grocery items I cannot buy in bulk.

The Peppermill is by all standards as good as it gets for Reno casino's. It's Vegas-like, but with a Reno vibe. Bright and clean, lots of neon and rotating nature scenes on huge screens from various arts of the world. They've got everything you would expect from a large property. Sports book, restaurants, plenty of gaming and convention space as well as various themed bars throughout. What can I say? Peppermill is by far the jewel of reno casino's.

Hands down the best spot in all of Philly! I'm actually partial toward their ice cream more than the water ice but always opt for the gelati where you can do two flavors of water ice with ice cream in between. The water ice is so fresh and not too sweet since they make it with real fruit. The ice cream is my favorite (the raspberry chocolate chip is to die for) in all of the city! Nothing beats a cup of water ice and ice cream in the summer! A must get if you are in the area and so affordable compared to other dessert spots! I wish I had pictures to share but I'm always too focused on eating and enjoying it :)
Reservationists not well informed.  Planned a whole day at their spa based on misinformation provided and then had to cancel.

I took our daughter's car there to get her catalytic converter replaced.  She had taken it to Nissan where she was told it had to be replaced.  They told her the new one would only have a 1 year 12,000 mile warranty.  We found that Quick Muffler gave a 5 year warranty and the price was better.  More important was the person we dealt with.  He had a great personality assuring me her car would be taken care of properly.  He was right.  We will be back now for oil changes and any other work that may be needed on her car as well as our cars.

Wish I could give this more stars! Heard of this place from a friend and was excited to try since the owner, Nina Compton, competed on Top Chef.

Everything here looks good but we decided on the coconut french toast, chicken hash (special) and the truffle and poached eggs. So good. 

Decor is super cute too. They open at 10am and weren't quite ready to seat people / lack of communication but other than that a fantastic experience.

Cozy & dark hideaway feel. A mix of music videos play throughout the lounge. Beautiful water-fire pit. Bartenders are great. I like this place to relax, gamble & enjoy their wide variety of mixed drinks. Pleasant little nooks to unwind throughout the lounge.

Delicious- reasonably priced- unique- and staff is extremely friendly!! A great place to bring visitors, family, or even a "imma treat myself" spot- I've never had shaved ice like this but after having Hawaiian shaved ice I feel spoiled and don't think I can go back to regular shaved ice ever again! This place is a must and I highly recommend adding the ice cream and the mochi to your order!

Doc Brien rocks! He made me feel welcomed the moment I walked in the door and the place was packed. I later brought my son in and it was the same experience. He has the place decorated in relaxing colors and has great reading material. His adjustments work and he is great at what he does.

The first time I went to big brand tires I came in saying that I needed all new tires and they convinced me otherwise. Since I have been back when I thought I heard a strange sound and a technician went for a drive with me to listen. I was just back today for my free tire rotation and their customer service is still great. I definitely trust these guys and have a great experience every time I go. Special shoutout to Ivan and his team!
Montrel"s is closed! The resto was cited over 75 times for health violations and failed to pay its bills! Shame and sad story!!
Very nice hotel. It was clean and comfortable. Nothing was at all wrong with the hotel and I enjoyed my stay.

I came here several times for social events and can't find anything good from this place.
It takes a while for the server to get me menu or even a glass of water.
The food is mediocre, nothing special. Meh quality...

The food here is mostly good. On the occasion that they get my order wrong the manager usually offers something up in return (which I usually decline; but appreciate the gesture). My biggest complaint would have to be the fact that every time I go in, a solid 5-6 minutes passes before I'm ever acknowledged. Sometimes I have to initiate the conversation all together which kind of bugs me. I know my standards are higher having worked in customer service forever, but this should definitly be changed. Just FYI: People don't like being ignored when they are spending money.
Older place. Needs updating and a good cleaning. Breakfast mediocre, the juice was warm and the OJ was a juice drink. Was ok for an overnight.
This place is amazing. There is a wide assortment of pastries including incredible almond croissants and macarons. I can't wait to come back!

Great place!! Atmosphere is lively. Nice bar. Great service! Had the Mardi Rita, grilled oysters 2 ways, crab cakes and fried alligator. Everything is so good. Can't wait to do breakfast/brunch! Love this place

The food was ok,  nothing to rave about. I went in on a Saturday evening with a group of several ladies. We arrived around 8:00pm and ordered at 8:20pm. I ordered a Caesar salad and the cauliflower steak. The salad came about 30 minutes later and the cauliflower steak came out an hour later. The service was lacking.
Tina was an amazing waitress, she took such good care of us. Food was good too.

This place was really good and it was a lot bigger than I thought it was.  We had reservations and were seated in the back right next to the kitchen as we watched them cook all the food.  The restaurant was busy and crowded and the service was nice and attentive.  One thing that we didn't enjoy too much (nothing against the restaurant itself) was this party of women across the room from us, and I swear one of the women had a laugh similar to a witch's cackle.  It was hard to enjoy our dinner when she was going off every 5 minutes.  No hard feelings for people enjoying their own dinners and having a good time but I wish they were more mindful of being inside around others.

We had the crispy Brussels sprouts to begin and they were roasted to perfection.  We shared the slow cooked oxtail ragout with a side of the baked jalapeno cheesy grits.  All of the food was so good.  The oxtail was tender and the grits were also so tasty.  I would come here again to try other items off of the menu for sure.

Excellent food, great customer service, nice location.
Hidden gem with authentic Cuban cuisine

Worst 3-star+ hotel experience of my life.  My company was there Tues-Fri for a conference, I paid fir 7 rooms for my team.  1 room had barely been cleaned, with trash still in the room & pubes on toilet.  1st nite our 2000 person conference had a welcome party at Falls Bar.  2 bartenders. The bar manager stood around doing nothing, while lines stacked up.  After waiting 45 minutes for a drink with no progress we, like hundreds of others, left.  The rest of the bars/restaurants were either closed or closed early (at 10ish) leaving everyone to go off site to extend any client entertainment.  You can only blame Covid for so long-pay damn bartenders $100/hr and you still make money (a lot!). During the day, you basically had the pizza restaurant (decent and guy from Egypt forget name was nice & wonderful), the convenience store (long lines) or the Cascade restaurant buffet, WAY overpriced & mediocre at best.  The Steakhouse was the only fining highlight--good value on wine list-but when you pay $1200 (8 of us) it better be good.  At $100/nt it would be average-at $200+ simply unacceptable (and over $10k for my team). I called the Spa on Tues to ask if they had a steam room and they said yes, but failed to tell me it was 'Closed due to Covid' WTF! And only open 9am-430p (during our conference???) so no way to steam anyway when I wanted to at 7a or 5p.  Upon arrival we were talking about coming back for our Spring conference-by end of week we decided Motel 6 would be a better option in Nashville.  Again, tired of the 'Covid Excuse'. Completely unacceptable
The Naan was super dry. The chicken masala was mediocre. Definitely not recommended given the high rating it currently has. The delivery service was ok.

I decided to give this place a try because they have the SNS nail dip power. The decor is beautiful but the staff is not professional or upscale. The nail techs are loud and share each others emery boards and electric nail drills without cleaning them between clients. I had to ask my nail tech to clean the electric nail drill prior to drilling/shaping my nails. I saw none of the five nail techs clean any of their equipment. My nails are okay. But I'll not be returning. The nail stations should be cleaner and the music was too loud as if it was a night club.

This is by far the worst CVS that I've ever been to the lady that's always working is awful she's probably one of the worst employees I've ever seen. She's so rude and not helpful at all. I drive out of my way to go to a different cvs just so I don't have to deal with her. Amanda is her name and she acts like it's the end of the world when she needs to help someone. Their self check out system isn't very good and requires an employee every time and she literally throws a fit every time.

If you're looking for a great charcuterie board look no further. My friend and I went on a Saturday afternoon for an early happy hour and charcuterie board. We came to The C House because they had parking and were not too busy. We also liked their patio for open air seating. They are enforcing physical distancing and mask requirements as well. I got a delicious cocktail and my friend and I split the 5 option charcuterie board. We were able to choose 5 options of a list of cheese and meats. The board also came with a healthy portion of grapes, champagne onions, honey, mustard, pickled green beans, and of course bread! It was delicious and a great snack that was basically a meal with how large the portions were!
The person who answered my phone call was knowledgeable and gave me very good advice.

Delicious hand made pasta.  Decent sized portions.  Smaller place so definitely make an appointment if you're going on peak hours/weekends.  Wait staff is hit or miss--i feel like they get busy and forget to check back for drinks,  bills, etc and we frequently have to flag them down.

We found this little place for breakfast. We had traditional New Orleans fare including grits and mimosas. 

Portions were generous and everything was delicious. The place is small and can get crowded, but the wait staff is super friendly and attentive. I wasn't able to get exactly what I wanted as they were out but the waitress suggest something else that was wonderful. .

J's is combination of two stands nestled in the French Market with outdoor seating. It has two sections - a stand with cooked food and then an oyster bar.

I was really looking forward to their crab claws, which they were out of, so my friends and I ordered the crawfish beignets, crawfish pie, and the fried crawfish tails. Everything we had was just okay, and nothing stood out besides the charisma of the employees.

I wanted to give a 4 stars but due to broken displays, lack of items for kids. For example the top floor has a nice water display. Kids were using ping pong balls to watch the flow. Which was great but 10 kids fighting over 4 balls was not fun. Second floor had broken touchscreen, the outside deck had a train pull display that clearly had missing part. There is going to be a lot of wear and tear with a place like this. Having spares would be a good idea for quick fix.
Love this place! I've been coming here for years for waxing. Natalie is the best! Great service! They make you feel very relaxed and welcome.
Bad customer service and employees very rude and not seem to be familiar with there schedule got the at 8pm and online said it was closed at 9 and told us we were to late.

This is always a pleasure. The atmosphere is fantastic. Our waitress was a bit confused and we didn't all get the things we ordered, but she was so sweet and called everybody "lovey", that nobody even got upset about the orders being mixed up a bit. 
The bacon here is absolutely the best. Nice and crisp without being burned beyond recognition. The coffee is great and the omelettes rock. 
The biscuit and gravy are another story though. It's more like a slice of bread and the gravy was just odd. The whole thing did neither look nor taste like biscuits and gravy. So if that is a favorite dish of yours, don't order it.

This Dental Group was proffesional & caring.They are organized & excellent. Dr.Charles Wu was great & so kind.He knows what his doing & always ready &willing to answer your questions.Staff are nice& friendly.Price is reasonable.Clean environment.Xray&Cleaning was amazing!.Highly Recommended!!!
Outstanding food & service !  My wife was impressed.  Ravioli & salad were very good. Small, intimate setting.  Friendly servers.  Fun place.

One of my top 5 places in Tucson! Located on the edge of 4th and University (street is currently under construction 5-5-12) it is a fantastic breakfast/lunch/dinner/late night choice for food and drinks.  Free Wi-Fi and a "hipster," vibe makes this a hotspot for students and others.  Prices are fair and the menu is extensive.  A new after midnight menu Thursday-Saturday is my favorite newest addition.

I'm a foodie and this place is paradise. Zuzu's kitchen is a hidden takeout spot in Fairmont that is an absolute gem. I've tried almost everything from their mouth watering Zuzu's burger to their delicious pizzas and their already famous Zuzu's Chicken sandwich. All I can say is..I have never once been disappointed. Whether you are picking up or getting delivery I highly recommend trying Zuzu's kitchen for its freshness, quality, balance and innovative twists to traditional quick eats.
I have ordered from Wing Hing's for years. I have tried other places but no one holds a candle to Wing Hing's food. It is so fresh and good.

We had 25+ pies delivered for lunch, that arrived exactly on time and very hot. This is the local favorite of our office. 

The pizza and the customer service is much better than the other, more popular places in Pennington. We will definitely be ordering our pizza from here in the future.

An OG diner with awesome food. My only problem was I couldn't decide what to order so our table looked like a buffet and we walked out with a ton of leftovers. Our server (I think Mary) was as sweet as could be. Owner was a great guy too. You can't go wrong for breakfast, lunch or dinner at Mama's!!

If you cannot find something on the menu that you like, then you must be a very, very picky eater.  When shopping at the outlet mall, I always stop here for lunch.  The diverse, ever changing menu is wonderful.

There are many beers and wines by the glass and the prices cannot be beat.  The menu is cutting edge for a nationwide chain, with many healthy choices.

I have to add the staff at the bar are seriously well trained and/or motivated...they never stop and they remain friendly.  Specifically Julie and Ashton.  They are amazing!

They have a mobile app and Rewards program which adds to the overall positive experience.

What a fun community event this was.  Had I not been a Yelp judge, I may not have even bothered to go.  Sometimes we just don't take advantage of the things that are right in our own backyard (figure of speech.. this was just a few blocks away).

After the disappointment of having an hours' delay in judging... the actual judging was fun.  Of course, it was pretty fast-paced eating.  15 wings in roughly 45 minutes is some serious heartburn waiting to happen... no matter how good the wings were.  While I enjoyed many of the flavors offered during our 4 PM tasting, I;m sad to say nothing jumped out to say "you gotta get some of this."  Maybe that was in the earlier or later tastings.  I should say, that nothing was awful... they were all good, except the last two options...14 was HOT, 15 was SUPER HOT.. took one bite and put it down.  Although I did hear about a maple/bacon flavored wing (I didn't get this one).  Would I do it again.... absolutely.  A shaded place to sit under a tent, nice an comfortable, plenty of wings, water, and a couple of drink coupons to boot.  How can you go wrong.

During the delay... what could you do.. go home or go into the casino... really what was the option.  Thanks for the delay.. I'm $300 richer (thanks Eldorado).

So get out there fellow Reno"ites"... live music, good eating, and the being part of the community.  Downtown Reno is no longer the scary place it used to be 10  years ago.  Once this event is over and in between the many events held during the summer... come on down, the river is flowing and there are pool areas for swimming, check our our new bridge, check out the shops in The Underground (old Post Office), and check out all the new local restaurants, and there are quite a few top notch restaurants in the Eldorado, Silver Legacy (host of the Wing Fest) and even Circus Circus.

It's nice to have a shower and a free bar but the breakfast food is SHIT here. 
Staff is friendly. Decor is pleasing. Coffee machine is good WHEN IT ACTUALLY WORKS...

Sunday morning, after a Saturday in Nashville, we want FOOD! Showed up around the 12 and got a booth immediately. Awesome. Food was sooo good, what we had. Bloody Mary was great. My friend had some raspberry champagne and it was very bubbly, but great if you love that stuff! I'd come back and recommend it. We even went to the shop on the next floor! Do it. And make your way to the rooftop bar. You won't be disappointed around the fire pits.

This is my favorite restaurant in town. The service is wonderful and the chefs are very enthusiastic. I recommend getting the shrimp and steak combo for dinner before 7 pm! Would definitely come back when visiting Santa Barbara.

Really good Seafood stop.  Love any of their soups.  And all seafood, blackened or fried.   Grouper is great either way!
The workers are always very nice even during the 'round noon busy time!!!!  A few of us....cohorts....go 2 or 3 Fridays a month and Maderas never fails!
AND once in a while we get rewarded with a freeby of something good....a nice bonus.
Their muscles was not that good.  But the lobster ravioli was incredible. And the waiter and other help was very good. Would definitely go back

Fantastic modern take on traditional Sonoran food.

Absolutely try the bone marrow, sooooo good!

Tortillas are amazing, they are clearly homemade.

We really, REALLY want to love this place but after two visits the odds are not in its favor. Since it's owned by the folks who brought us 1111 Mississippi and Vin de Set, we had high expectations but this place falls down on the little things--which many of the reviewers have noted. After the first (meh!) visit we thought it was a fluke. But 0 for 2?; shame on me if I make it 3. I think it shows how hard it is to consistently deliver a quality pie and we should appreciate even more those (few!) places in The Lou that do so.

First the good: the interior is (mostly) awesome. Exposed brick, open kitchen, halfway between warehouse and loft space. Folks from Boston will love it! The sausage: house made fennel sausage! Awesome. The red sauce: exquisite! Just the right balance of sweet and hot (arrabiata). Loved it! The thin crust is crispy with nice bubbling, not sweet. A total absence of provel makes this a love it or hate it kinda place--depending on how you like your pie.

The bad: the lighting! This requires a serious overhaul. Can lights placed where they do no good; halogen spots shine in your eyes. Good luck reading a menu, spotting your waiter, or enjoying the sights. Go during the day if you can! The A/C will blow you out of the place. I realize this is to balance the heat put out by the gas ovens in the open kitchen but yeesh! Bring a sweater or hoodie. You'll need one!

First time, we ordered The Wolf. Very greasy to the point of soggy. Second time, half Hawaii Five-O; half sausage, onion, mushrooms. They added the mushrooms after the pizza was cooked. They were still cold! Ordered iced tea but had to ask for sweeteners (none on table). Iced tea was off tasting and sent it back for a pear cider.

My recommendations: retool the interior with an eye toward better, user-friendly lighting and overhaul the menu in favor of a simple, quality product. The pretentions to be a gourmet pizza restaurant just aren't carried through in the uneven service and iffy food. 

If I'm halfway between a Dewey's and PW's guess which direction I'll be headed?

I was a bit skeptical of this place from the moment it opened. One: the location seems odd to me but maybe it's because I rarely make my way to Marathon Motor village during the day time. Two: the theme. Many Nashville restaurants take advantage of garage-style doors and even have similar themes. The difference? They do it well. Garage coffee company felt more like I was there to get my oil changed than to get a solid cup of coffee. It felt like it was trying to cater a crowd that's non-existent in the Nashville coffee scene. 

I often tell people that I have two criteria for liking a coffee shop and it only needs to meet one of them. A) Have a great environment or B) serve a really good product. Garage does neither. Their coffee is  equivalent to a cup you may get at Starbucks, possibly even worse. Sorry, folks.

This restaurant review is really only about the Happy Hour.  Lately, that has been my MO.  In the summer I don't like to eat huge meals so Happy Hours work great.  It's really hard to judge a restaurant correctly this way.  So guys, just remember this was a Happy Hour review and doesn't reflect their true menu.  Went there Friday night with our friends.  It was the four of us all looking to share some delectables.  Unfortunately, it didn't quite make it for us.  We shared the Calamari which was fried but came dry without a sauce, no lemon.  It was tasty but I believe could have been better.  Also the smash burger.  I couldn't understand why they called it that.  Except that is a new term for a trend in burgers these days.  Since one is opening up in town with just that name (Smash Burger) on Grant and Swan.The burger was very plain and tasteless.  Also ordered the Mahi tacos which just got a so so for us.  The highlight was the fish and chips.  Actually, the fish was made to perfection.  Crispy, dry on the outside with a beautiful white fish inside.  I'd highly recommend that.  The fries were very plain and ordinary to say the least.  Ordered the salad on the happy hour and it was totally bland. I would come back just for the fish and disregard the chips. The service was fine.  We had a lovely, cheery server.  The place is trendy and quite lovely with the views of the mountains.  By the time we left the place was hopping mostly at the bar.  It is definitely worthwhile going to.  I love to see Restaurants do well here in Tucson. I will be back.  I'm not trying to bad mouth this place but  because I am an honest reviewer I might be coming off a little harsh.   I will be back and get the fish and try some other interesting dishes.  They do have an extensive selection of Happy Hour dishes.  Even more than other restaurants.  So certainly it is worth coming here and enjoying this trendy spot.
Very change resistant feel bland food the waiter telling each other the fuck off make for a wonderful atmosphere  one and done well not go back

chargrilled oysters---GET THEM NOW!! 

I am dreaming of them as I sit here clear across the country from Drago's
Very good food, fast and friendly service. One of the few decent breakfast places in the French Quarter. Great coffee as well! Worth the walk from anywhere in the area. You won't be disappointed!

Born and raised in Louisiana-best shrimp poboy I've ever had!! Newly remodeled, clean and pleasant. Counter lady was really nice and helped me decide between a large and small. Small was huge and I could only finish half. Bread was perfect and shrimp were nice sized and not greasy. Even the fries were light and delicious. 

Will definitely be back!!

This place just makes me irritated.  These people realize this is a zero quality fast food place, right?  Their "food products" are somewhere below generic lunch counter, and somewhere above school cafeteria food.

When this is the case, the LEAST they can do is be prompt, and they just aren't.  They're slow as heck when I ordered just one blizzard.

Basically, they've got a very mediocre product, one which I considered overpriced, and since it's too darn slow, what's the darn point?
The service was terrible. The food was cold and late. It's not the waiters' fault- it's the kitchens disorganization.

Don't go here if you are dairy sensitive. While their website lists several options of dairy free sorbets they only have one and will insist a cone is the wrong choice so your friends will eat ice cream and you will watch.

The concept of Subway-style Mexican fast food has been around for well over a decade now, but I do remember that Qdoba was an early pioneer in that format.  

The Qdoba at Clay Terrace is situated toward the middle of the outdoor mall, near the Corner Bakery.  I've always found the service to be decent, and the food quality is on par with other quick-serve Mexican fast food restaurants of its kind.  Qdoba has made an effort in recent years to change their menu and have it keep pace with changing customer tastes and dining habits.  I usually stick with the tried & true menu items, like the Queso burrito.  It's not exactly calorie-friendly, but it's a crowd pleaser.

Visited this place last weekend. I ordered Strawberry Cheesecake and was told, they can't make it cause they're out of cheesecake bits. So I opted for the Taro and was told that they don't have it either. I went to the mall to try this place and left disappointed with their service.

My review is based on sampling the other ramen, but mainly ordering the terakawa ramen. Usually, when trying a new restaurant out, i tend to order the house special. If  it's named after the restaurant, it should probably be their best dish and in this case, it was. 

I've been there twice and ordered the Terakawa bowl both times. I've sampled friends' dishes that went with the standard ramen, shoya and such, but they were vastly inferior. I would not recommend ordering those at all. As far as the standard ones go, the noodles are different
Very good, lots of unique dishes; would recommend the burger on pao de queijo with yucca fries, and the coxinha chicken-filled pastry
First time back here 20 years. It was delicious. Clams, muscles, pork tacos and chip and salsa of course. Delicious and spicy.
Great food great service!!  One of my favorite places to eat. Love going on Tuesdays bite and then going to the movies.

Some of the best Thai food I ever ate. We have been here dozens of times and it is always very very good!  It is our family go-to place.  Consistently good and always fresh. Always has plenty of business because people know good food! :)

Definitely in between Minado and the typical Chinese buffet. Quality is slightly less than Minado but slightly better than the latter. The rolls are slightly oversauced but plentiful in type. There is not green tea or red bean ice cream machine, but they do have vanilla and a dessert bar. The other difference I noticed is that there are more Korean food items, and also a Soondubu bar for the enthusiast. I did not try this, so I can't comment on the taste.

I do recommend the Shabu-Shabu- you tell your server and he/she brings a pot of clams (soup base) to your table. You can pick your choice of meat, seafood and veggies and bring it to your table to cook. Their shabu shabu sauce is tasty. 

3 stars is just about right if you choose wisely.

My sister brought me to Katie's
For my last meal in NOLA. 
I was craving something local. 
Like a PoBoy and a cola!

Like many places around town 
There's a plaque showing the water line. 
But one big, nasty hurricane 
Won't squash peoples desire to dine!

From pics, I knew I wanted to try
The yummy crawfish beignet. 
The dough was flaky, the seafood fresh,
The cheese sauce spicy like Kimye!

But what I really came here for
Was an authentic NOLA PoBoy. 
Sadly, I was disappointed. 
It was more like a So-So Boy. 

The breading didn't have much flavor
Most of the shrimp still had veins. 
But I just asked for remoulade and ate it. 
I'm usually not one who complains. 

My sis really liked her crab cakes. 
Garnished with more lump meat on top. 
Overall, I enjoyed my experience,
I was happy to have Katie's as our last stop.
Food was okay. Staff was friendly. Owner blew up at me on google for staying the food was "plain". There are so many other choices to dine that I could really not care less.

I wasn't really expecting to love Hablo Taco based on the mixed Yelp reviews, but I actually really liked it!

Upon arrival, I noted a very touristy vibe in here (daiquiri machines on the walls, over the top decor, etc).  I was a bit nervous about the food due to this, but the food was actually very very good.

I started with a sangria rita (2 of my favorite things mixed together).  It was a very large drink and for the size, I don't think that the $9 price tag was too bad.  We started with the sriracha guacamole (YUM) and the loaded queso (it had bacon in it) and both were very tasty.  For my meal I had the grilled avocado (filled with fresh ahi tuna and crema sauce) and the Mexican street corn.  The ahi tuna was SO incredibly fresh and the avocado was just perfect - highly recommend this dish.  The Mexican street corn was also very well done and quite scrumptious!  Everyone at my table was happy with their meals from tacos to salads.

Our server was very sweet and was prompt on refilling our chips and getting us anything we requested.   Honestly, I had a very good experience here and I look forward to coming back in the future.

Swamp Tour! Great driver that picked us up on-time from our hotel. Then drove us around to some parts of NOLA since we were all on time, so had some extra time. She showed us some parts of New Orleans destroyed by Hurricane Katrina. Gave us her perspective of what life was like before and after the disaster. Learned a lot from here.

The tour was great. Our swamp boat driver was great. Saw many alligators, and he got them to come really close too, enough for one to jump and ram its body into the side of our boat to reach the sausage/chicken he was feeding them. He was also interacting with the people on the boat, trying to get to know us, too!

Driver back was good, too,

Definitely a great tour. I highly recommend!

This is my favorite deli in the world. So much so that they now know my name, regular order, and my voice when I call in. I'm not joking. And it's awesome.

I always get the house salad and the chicken parmigiano sandwich. The dressing on the house salad is RIDICULOUS. I try to use only half of it so that I can save it to eat the next day on a homemade salad. And their sauce on the chicken parmigiano totally makes the sandwich. That and the yummy, toasty bread.

It's very close to where I work, so I probably go once a week. It's addictive.

As if the appeal that Drake and Beyonc stay here when they are in town wasn't enough, The Hutton Hotel in Tennessee captures the essence of luxury and excellent customer service. Upon entering I was greeted with an amazing staff and a free glass of wine. My concierge and staff was accessible by a text message and they were more than accommodating to my every need. The Hutton is also very environmentally friendly, all electricity in your room is accessed through your key card. The room is amazing overlooking the beautiful Tennessee streets, The Hutton is placed perfectly on Broadway, and is not too far away from the bars and restaurants. The ambiance of the room is stellar and creates an environment that makes you feel comfortable and at home. I never wanted to leave and at 21 years I'm considering saving up enough money just to stay here one more night. By far one of the best hotel experiences I've ever had, I wish I was able to give more than 5 stars.

went here for a late dinner. food and drinks were both great. it can get cramped in there but most popular places in rittenhouse can get that way I guess. we found a small piece of plastic in our food (which we finished anyway bc it was delicious) and they handled it so well. after we let our server know, a manager came out and apologized profusely then sent us complimentary crab cakes which were very tasty. my fav were done & dusted, potato croquettes, polenta dish. we also had ricotta, mushroom toast thing, charred caesar and bucatini which were all also prepared well.

Went to Taco Bell on Pyramid Hwy across from Savemart in Spanish Springs tonight. Placed our order at 7:25pm. At about 7:35pm I asked to speak with the manager. I was informed she was busy by the guy up front. He refused to go back and let her know I wanted to speak with her. After watching several other people get there food some with extra food for the delayed service and some with just getting what they ordered our order finally came up at 7:52pm. That is a 27 minute wait for fast food. I asked again to speak to the manager. She told the gentleman who brought our food up she couldn't talk and to handle it. He informed me he was a shift leader and how could he help. I said I want to speak with the manager. When he told her she said I'd have to wait. I said there was no waiting and she could speak with me then. I started to speak and she interrupted. I told her to let me finish. My question was why was no one told in the dining room for eat in or carry out told of a long wait time and how would this be corrected? Brie  (the manager) informed me she could refund me my money. I told her I was not looking for a refund but an explanation as to why no one was told of an extended wait. She said corporate never said they had too and that there were large orders being placed inside and through the drive thru. I said that is ridiculous and that all customers should matter. The rudeness I recieved from the moment we walked in to the moment we left has left such a disgusted taste in my mouth that WE WILL NEVER GO BACK AGAIN!!! Corporate you need to change your management team and team members and  be there to show them what CUSTOMER SERVICE IS!!!!!

The burgers aren't bad. The meat is quite flavourful, but seemed to seriously lack salt/pepper. The onion rings and fries were both so-so, nothing special. They didn't have dijon or brown mustard, which I found odd for a gourmet burger place. I'm also not so sure why they're using chopped iceburg lettuce on the burger since chopped lettuce creates a serious bun slippage problem. Overall, it's a good burger, but it could be so much better with a few changes. My wife did like the fact that the "Snack Burger" is perfect in size for her rather small appetite, and it's only $4 so that's a plus.

Best vegan food!  I am obsessed with their gyros!  So amazing and I love the coleslaw and French fries, and although I try to limit my fries (it is hard to do because they are the best!), I still get them.

Service is great too.
