Didn't flinch. Not once. Obvious where everyone was at or would pop out of, most of the "attractions" are fake.

If it were in Virginia, it'd be VA-Chinatown. And I'd come here even more. So to speak.

One thing I am certain of, is that it's more exciting that the largest city in Saskatchewan. Without doubt, you're better off in Chinatown than Reginatown.

Philadelphia has a beautiful Chinatown with little alleys and a crisscross of roads that reminds me a little bit of a slightly larger Boston Chinatown, and it's significantly better than the one in DC, but what isn't.

It's a traditional Chinatown with a big gate right in the heart of the city, which makes for a great tourist attraction. There is some really great Boba around here too, as well as some not-so-good Boba.

But I would say some of the best Boba in the Philly area is within 4 blocks of this gate, and there's plenty of amazing food located right here in Chinatown, which makes it a real destination for us, and we like it. Parking is an issue though, like at your mother's place.

For Boba try Mr Wish, KFT, Mr Camp, Tsaocaa, Tea Do (open later), and more.

My old review said:

A lot of people think of NYC and San Francisco as the Chinatowns of the USA. But cities like Boston, DC, Houston and Philadelphia have wonderful Chinatowns of their own, complete with the "gate" and all.

The Philly Chinatown is much smaller and less-frequented than the one in NYC, but it's absolutely wonderful. It's mainly just 1 street, although technically it's several square blocks. The one street is like being in China itself, but in a Philly terraced row-houses neighbourhood setting. There's a little of everything, and if you like Chinese food and goods, you'll never get tired. There are some nice dessert and bubble tea shops along here too.

Perhaps the best part is that Chinatown Philly is close to everything. It's about 10 minutes walk from the Liberty Bell and 5 minutes walk from Reading Terminal Market, which has much of the best food in town. It's one of the most notable and enjoyable little Chinese neighborhoods in North America.

So if you feel saddened or down
I know just what will erase your frown
We'll both strip down naked
Steal a car, and take it
Out joyriding in Chinatown.

If you want something from this Starbucks you need to go through the drive-through. The wait times are extremely long. You go inside hoping to get your drink and as you watch them serve every car in the drive-through before they get to your order it is frustrating. I've given this place about six tries now but it has consistent customer service. I think I'll take a pass.

So happy we decided to take a tour with Ernie. His knowledge, love and enthusiasm about the city makes his tour a must see.   While learning about the city he also made it fun.  I walked away reciting fun facts to friends.  Highly recommended.

Two people can eat for $20, if they don't order drinks. I love the veggie burger. The fries and onion rings are great, too. It's a nice outdoor setting, if the weather is fine. 101 Freeway is right there, so that can be a bit noisy.

The kids behind the counter are fast, efficient and helpful. Lots of smiles.

My only gripe is that some people allow their kids to run around, with noticeably little to no supervision. We were having a really nice lunch, until a little girl (definitely old enough to know better) wouldn't let up on chasing birds. Around and around she went, terrorizing the birds.  Mommy didn't even look up. 

The sandbox is a nice feature, and I noticed kids making new friends, which was sweet.

The ribeye is delicious and so are the sides that came with it.

It was cooked perfectly and service was excellent.

I recommend coming here. Although pricey, I would still come back.

Of all the lunch places that I frequented during my time working downtown, Blues City deli is the place that I miss the most.

The Italian Beef with sweet and hot peppers is by far my favorite sandwich here, but the overkill of green olive tapanade on the muffeletta is a close 2nd.  Also, given how generous they are with toppings with the Blues City dog, I'd choose this place over plenty other hot dog spots.

Either way, when deciding to come here, always plan for a spot to eat at once you get your food.  I think I've only eaten on location once.  Every other time was either at some picnic table elsewhere, back at the office, or just in the car, Sonic style.

I think I'm going to find random excuses to grab lunch with people just to eat here.

We came during a busy weekend of Essence Festival. There as no hostess to greet the many people waiting at the entrance. The manager was very rude to the customers who tried to explain who was next in line. The waiting list was not updated and several guest left. The food was good but the experience was less tasty

Hostess was unenthused about her job. With plenty of open tables our party of 5 was seated at a "pew style" corner booth meant for 4. Our additional person sat on the end of the table. Drinks took 10 mins after we sat down and a basket of bread was offered 1/2 way through the meal... thanks but no thanks! Tiramisu Martini without the Lady Finger left the drink "undressed" and disappointing. The waitress took our food order but didn't deliver to the table the items she wrote down. Service was slow and unattentative. No meatball with my tortellini... and no apology for it. Chicken and Pesto special was greasy with oil floating on top. Chicken Marsala is fried and very untasty. Italian restaurant without Tiramisu as a dessert.... should've been a sign the experience would be poor. Before departing a lack luster lunch, we visited the ladies room. Passing 4 employees hanging around chatting no surprise to find 2 out of 4 stalls without paper and stuff on the floor. Skip this location unless you like your spaghetti without balls!

We've been there several times now, and the employees are absolutely wonderful.  My child is a huge fan of chicken, and can name who has the best and who doesn't... which is dry, which is greasy, and which one is perfect.  This is  now her favorite.  The employees make it a great place to go... always friendly and respectful.

Close this review right now and start driving to The Shoppes at New Tampa.  Leave regret in your rearview mirror and don't EVER question your decision to drive the extra 17 minutes to Asian Buffet. 

Sure it's going to cost $1 more, but that's what it takes to avoid the deep sadness I'm feeling right now.  The differences between a $7.99 and $8.99 experience are astounding:

For starters, eating in a poorly planned cafeteria setting with power cords all over the walls and very misleading food images posted in the windows as you enter VS a modest exterior and an immediate eyeful of a buffet that punches you in the face with possibilities before you're brought to one of three separate dining areas.

Secondly, taking a first plate that already feels like you've settled for disappointment and shouda, woulda, coulda's VS a first plate that hasn't even scratched the surface of what looked delicious.

Third, did I mention how sad I am right now??

Fourth, 2 servers, 1 hibachi/sushi chef and 1 buffet attendant VS more staff than you can shake a stick at.  Don't get me wrong, this place has really nice servers but something has to make up for the stingy buffet tables they can't afford to even keep half full...

...and that's where I'll finish this up.  Compared to Asian Buffet, this place is a food desert and I had to fight through a scattered mess of fried or cheese covered insanity to find anything remotely Asian and/or healthy.  The move by places like this to cheapen their culinary culture to feed a bunch of fat Americans more calories than Asians will consume in a week is disgusting on so many levels.  I guess if you throw enough gawdy neon lights in a place and slap up a fish tank I'm supposed to be impressed by your exotic oriental heritage???

I'm over it.  The only thing Imperial here is the amount of failure they managed to pack into a single hour of my life!

Ted Drewes is synonymous with Saint Louis and I absolutely get it. I have never been disappointed by the amazing custard here. They have many recipes you can order from or create your own. My favorite is the Christy, an iced brownie with a scoop of vanilla custard covered in hot fudge and caramel. It is unbelievable! Don't let the line worry you, especially in the summer it can look crazy, but they open up so many windows for ordering it always moves quickly and is definitely worth the wait!

Well we gave the Wing House another try and the wings were fabulous! A shot out to Olivia our server who I am sure made it happen. Thank you to Matthew the mgr. who stood there while I tried them to make sure they were good.

I love Vietnamese food and when I have a craving for it, Asian Pho is my go to although it's the furthest from my home. For those who don't know me I don't mind traveling anywhere for great food. Please Note: **The five stars is strictly for the food.** I have always had good service, but I come with my half Vietnamese friends so I'm not sure if that's why. Based on other reviews, service here is hit or miss.
I generally visit on Saturdays or Sundays so I can order their special the Bahn Xeo  since they are only offered those two days and I always have to have a bowl of their delicious pho. There is something about their broth that keeps me coming back. For those who don't really like pho, they also offer combo plates with rice with generous portions of meat and rice. Once you overlook this restaurant is located in a gas station you'll be happy you gave it a shot.

Out of the main bridges in Philly this one is y favorite.The shade of blue really captures the character of the city, simple, beautiful, and candid. It is a splendid way to return home after traveling. Love this bridge, except when driving east...

The food here is good, but I had a bad experience.  There's very little parking out in front of this place and a sign directs patrons to the back parking lot.  What the sign doesn't mention is that the back lot - shared with an auto repair shop - is closed with a big gate and locked at 9 PM.

I had dinner here on a Saturday night, then ran an errand with a friend.  Came back about 10 to find my car behind a padlock and razor wire, in an area with a high fence (also razor-wired).  Messages left on the voice mail, Facebook posts, even a note taped to the front door went unreturned and I wound up being without my car for over 36 hours (the restaurant isn't open Sunday and doesn't open Monday until 11 AM.)  To make matters worse, I had parked near a dumpster and now the smell of spoiled food is pretty bad inside the car.  Hopefully it'll wear off soon.

If you eat here, keep both eyes on your vehicle!  I thought the Pad Thai was excellent, but based on my experience I won't be back soon.  Nobody even apologized, which I thought was the least they could do.

I've heard horror stories about other reality companies in the area.  Solo reality was very easy to work with and they were very flexible.  Also, they would sent maintenance right away, even on weekends or the next morning.  They even installed an AC unit I ordered for free!  The property manager, Sean Rapp, was very flexible and easy to work with in particular.

I used All three's for over two weeks when staying in the area. The drivers were all friendly and on time. I mainly used the sedan car service. The bigger cars were all clean but the regular taxis were dirty and a bit beat up so I'd recommend the sedan car service. The price was fair. The phone staff except for one lady was the worst. Terrible phone manners. I found out they have an app I could use and that way I was able to avoid the calls. The app works just like uber. I gave this 4 stars because of the great drivers I encountered and I will use them again for that reason. This would have been a five star review if it were not for the poor phone customer service.

I go to this place pretty much every time I visit my parent in Gulfport and I am fan.I love the happy hour specials. If you are a local you get a card and you get happy hour all day everyday so having my parents live there always gives me a discount. The staff is very friendly, the drinks aren't expensive. It's a great place to sit down with friends and have some drinks and catch up. The upstairs section has a great view of the beach and it's definitely worth checking out!

Absolutely excellent. Wonderful service and amazing food. The chef is an artist with very innovative flavors. Had the falafel cakes, the artichokes, a spinach fettuccine pasta special that was literally one of the best pastas of my life and the cardamom waffles. Everything we tried struck the perfect balance between being light but still flavorful.

A lot of character. Food was good. Our family's order included roasted chicken, fried feast platter, fried green tomatoes. Portions were big, food flavorful, prices normal. Was convenient to our stay at the Gaylord Marriott.

Before Katrina I survived on August Moon's special fried rice from Prytania location bc it was tasty, they brought it to me and I would eat on it for days.  On an adventure to the WB with a friend, we decided to check it out before heading back to the EB.  Of course we were not let down.  We arrived still in time for the lunch special.  The special includes your choice of a fried yummy treat and soup.  I ordered the moo goo gai pan with crab rangoons and egg drop soup.  This combo is one of my personal faves.  I can eat it every day.  I have to say though, this isn't THE best Chinese food I've ever had, but it's freak'n pretty close.  And for the cost of this meal... $13.00!!!  Yup!

One thing I must mention that I wasn't pleased with was the service.  Our server needs to step up her game.  

Bc this place is new, it's much nicer then it's sister restaurant.  They Prytania location needs some updating with the decor fo sho.  I usually either pick up my order or have it delivered but still the atmosphere and decor is old school.
My favorite lunch spot on the Main Line!  A true gem.  BEST service - friendliest staff - scrumptious food!
Good Service! Found exactly what I was looking for! Final sale and 70 dollar delivery fee seem a little ridiculous! But I was happy with my purchase!

Very solid meal, hot chicken was as good as Hattie B's in Nashville. Garlic fries we're super drenched in garlic sauce tasted perfect.
As an added bonus they have a manager dude who is a Dopplegang for gus fring, the chicken guy from breaking bad.  Topped it off with a PBR, great meal!

Great location, Brunch buffet has a really good variety, and the mimosas were tasty and inexpensive ($4 with the Brunch buffet). On the bad side, they apparently allow dogs in the outdoor dining area (there was someone there with a large dog while I was dining) and the valet (whom I realize do not work for Jackson's Bistro) kept a $3 tip for himself without asking (I would have tipped him that much, but he just gave me $10 back from a twenty for a $7 valet fee. I don't support those tactics), was seen by another in my party driving recklessly in the garage, and when I picked up my vehicle both attendants left to retrieve cars and they left the lockbox open and with the key to the box in the lock, with people's car keys in the box.

I ordered potato soup and a Reuben sandwich. Food was less than mediocre. Hostess and waitress were rude. The restaurant was empty except for one other party. Over priced for the quality of food. Would not recommend.

I couldn't help but walk in here pre-dinner to check out the goods.  The aesthetics of their pastries were quite pleasing to both eyes and palate. Post dinner we came back and perused a bit more before deciding on a macadamia cookie, an almond croissant, and a pretty looking fig/olive tart.  Everything tasted good.  It was nice that they have a rewards program.  I signed up on the spot and ended up getting the cookie for free.  Not bad.  The fifth star will be determined by the breads next time i come around.  The open kitchen is nice for being nosy.  Limited number of tables/chairs down the long hall.

Always great food, nice vibe and the wait staff is always friendly. 
If you don't like Hoaglin to Go, you will be in trouble finding a great place to eat in Indianapolis.

My husband loves the wings and i love the portobello burger and some of the appetizers. We got takeout from Moes tonight and when we took a bit, realized it was spoiled. Two Fat Guys to rescue! Take out from here made everything better.

My husband says these are the best wings in northern Delaware.
Great food . Salads and pizza are amazing . Have them bake your pizza a little less .. Sometimes it is crunchy since its thin crust , but still good.

Yummy.  If you are looking for an excellent 
salad and/or sandwiches this place fits the bill.  We ordered a hooks cheddar sandwich and a Parmesan reggiano salad.  Both were excellent.  

It's  small, clean, no table service and definitely worth the visit.

Gyspie Elise is just one of the best life voice I heard. She is fantastic. 
Too bad she sings in this bar where you can not drink unless you wait 20 min (minimum) at the bar (when send you to another bar tender to make your cocktail), whereas it is not crowded. 
2 stars for the wait ... This is sad because cocktails were really good.

I grew up eating Korean foods.  I only did the take out and the bibimbap was amazingly superb.  The kuchujang sauce was just right for me.  Not too spicy with enough kick. The bowl was very filling or maybe I was to hungry.. Lol.  Nevertheless the veggies we're fresh and the bulgogi was super tender. Like I said earlier this is kick ass good stuff, right down to the perfectly cooked rice.  I like the fact that it came with miso soup.  The miso was also delicious. Good value for all this food. 
The Kim bap reminded me of what they call in South Korea "drug" Kim bap. It's called that because it's addicting and you can't stop eating it! 
Im going to have to come back and try the stone pot bibimbap and jop chae

Service was awesome.

This review is based solely on their customer service. I forgot to get anything in the mail for my best friend's birthday who lives in Indy (I live in Texas). I called Kim's because they were in close proximity to her office. I believe the young lady helping me was Ashley. I told her my situation, she called me back to confirm they could do a next day delivery and handled the rest. My girlfriend loved the surprise and I looked great for remembering! Thanks Ashley! Oh, and at 36 dollars for a dozen cupcakes & delievery, you really can't go wrong.
Delicious tuna tartare & boiled shrimp.  Lovely outside dining.

When I was in Delaware for a leisure and business trip, I decided to take my friend to Buffalo Wild Wings for dinner because he has never been there before. It was a tremendous place with lots of TV's so we didn't miss a minute of all the NFL games, but the service was spotty as we ordered a traditional and boneless wings plate and it wasn't ready until 20-25 minutes later. BWW is a sit down restaurant and bar, but the wait time should be a little shorter. Overall, the food was not bad and we got what we paid for, I guess.
Love the vibe of this place & the coffee is delicious. You really get a neighborhood feeling & everyone is always so friendly. I look forward to trying the food.

Sunday Jazz Brunch
BBQ Shrimp
Bloody Mary

Based on a recommendation by a local store owner, we squeezed Mr. B's Bistro into our NOLA foodie sojourn.  It wasn't difficult really, as yelper Chris T. says, because I called the afternoon before and getting into Sunday Brunch was eezy peezy.  Definitely nothing like getting into Commander's Palace...(yea, I'm a little bitter about being turned away for not having a lunch reservation and making the $14 cab ride over)

The band for Sunday brunch was great; they took requests and were talented for what we've thus seen.  And though the layout of Mr. B's makes it seem like there are 'no good seats in the house', the band travels around sections of the restaurant.  What a treat! 

Now, the food and the cocktail were delicious.  Then, why did I give them 3 stars???!!!  The BBQ shrimp sauce was a little too salty for me and the shrimp a little overdone (peel and eat shrimp).  My boyfriend was impressed with it and it was his choice dish, so I could understand his tasty review.  However, my other thought was, I can't believe this costs $22/$28(?)!  Likewise, my little Bloody Mary was $6...we had a Bloody Mary twice the size at Bourbon House later that day (maybe not as well made).  

Mind you, I realized that we lucked out this weekend on being present during Restaurant Week and I'm sure I got sucked into believing the lower prices exist everywhere in NOLA...

But, Mr. B's was not worth the $$$ to me.  The service was just fine and the food as well...Perhaps, I'm not a believer of Dickie Brennan establishments...

Fucking horrible service shitty staff and stupid music 
I expected better but that's what you get in St Pete for free

My girlfriend and I were at Indeblue this Wednesday, and I am happy to say that this neo Indian (I like to call it food with a contemporary classicist flair) restaurant did not disappoint and impressed our hungry stomachs. I was compelled to make an instant comparison with Tashan on several levels.
What stood out immediately was the decor while we were being led into the restaurant...Indian motifs with a modern flair, again reminiscent of Tashan perhaps..but it certainly had its  unique appeal. The location of Indeblue in my mind will be key to its success. Tashan feels a tad far out for the likes of us that like to sip and hang around the Walnut/Chestnut to South St. types of locales.
The menu does not disappoint either- they have a great spread of appetizers, entrees, veggie options and naans. The cocktail list looked like a cheery collection of Inde-Bollywood style names and fun flavors. We got the Bollywood sparkler (?) and the Chai tea sangria. The chai tasted better than Bollywood sparkler (this tasted too bubbly/frizzy for me) - the sangria was light and had hints of chai and brandy- a great combo to get a pitcher of, though it didn't sound appetizing in its description.
The service was worthy of nothing. Well informed servers that were good with suggestions. Don't get me wrong.. I am perfectly capable of choosing my tikkas, naans and rasams but given that the menu had an obvious personal flair of the chefs cooking style, it always helps to see how keen the chef is on informing the staff on his/her offerings. 
To start we had the long hots and the crispy veg. chilli- to me a rendition of the stuffed long green chillies and the Indo-Chinese Hakka noodles. The paneer mozzarella combo in the green chillies were perfect-creamy, the chillies added bite and the tangy tomato sauce rounded the flavour off. The veg chilli had zucchinis in it (which I found interesting) but was a good subtle complement to the bold/spicy sauce (more gravy than sauce). The veggies had not lost their crunch despite the sauce on the noodles. To those familiar with Indo-Chinese food-the addition of the 3 side sauces (vinegar w/ green chillies, green chilli sauce and soy) completed my experience of eating this glamorized version of hakka noodles. spot on!!
For the main course, we had a meat and a veg option. Both were superb in their portion sizes, taste, flavour. We ordered the stuffed squash (this came with saffron rice) and osso bucco pork vindaloo. 
The meat dish came with bone in which was perfect, the meat was melt in your mouth worthy cooked. It was a great meat, potatoes and gravy dish that is typically comfort food for me.  The vindaloo gravy did not have the pungency of vinegar that I seek, but completed the dish just fine.  I can see how an overpowering amount of vinegar can turn customers away from this dish. The garlic naan was fresh, however I am not sure if it was made in a tandoor or sigri, and I could taste uncooked flour in some parts of the bread- I chose to overlook this. The stuffed squash in my girlfriend's words- it was creamy (perhaps slightly excessively so) but very tasty, very well cooked, could have had a hint bit more of spice but she enjoyed it overall. If this was a take on "malai kofta" it was certainly well executed.
Overall, I would go back and recommend it to others. Chef Rakesh Ramola certainly had the right idea with opening IndeBlue here in Philly. The prices could be comparable to Tashan, the food is just as good as Tashan's Chef Shende and Chef Senat. Where it beats Tashan is the location and the restaurant size. The location is always popping (regardless of weather or economic paucity), the place's size will make certain that it looks full even on days where only a few occupy the bar and tables- a definite draw for guests to peer in.
Disappointing. Criollo's setting is appealing, but service was amateurish and our breakfast was mediocre.

Wonderful customer service!!  Would definitely recommend. Mike was my sales associate and was extremely knowledgable!  I had to custom order a piece in a timely manner, he kept me updated the entire time.  I felt very taken care of.  :)

I saw the good yelp reviews on Bon Bon so we tried out their delivery last night.

We got a few things so we could try different items. We started out with edamame and shrimp shumai. The edamame was typical nothing special there. The shrimp shumai was good. They were like little shrimp purses. 

Next we tried the bon bon tacos and bonzilla sushi burrito. The tacos were decent but we felt they needed something to give it a kick of spice. The bonzilla burrito was pretty awesome. Its has spicy tuna, shrimp tempura, avocado, and cucumber with a few sauces to give it great flavors. This was definitely the best thing we tried.

Lastly we got a few sushi rolls. Philadelphia, spicy tuna, and chicken tempura. The rolls were fresh but nothing out of the ordinary.

All and all, I would definitely go back for the sushi burritos. Amazing concept and excellent execution. If you are looking for straight sushi rolls this would probably be disappointing but for a fun place to get a sushi taco or burrito this place hits the spot.

We were here on a Thursday evening. There was a crowd around the bar, but the rest of the place was empty. There was only one other booth occupied.
The beer selection was great. I had the poutine (meh... not enough gravy; I wouldn't order it again) and the chicken & goat cheese salad (really, really good).  
Service was super-friendly. The only downside was that we ate with our coats on, because it was COLD in there.

I AM HAVING THE BEST FOOD EVER! We came to Indy on business and were looking for a place to eat that stayed open past 10. Spotted The Eagle and are SO GLAD we walked in. Heather was the sweetest server who made excellent recommendations and took special care knowing my colleague and I were from San Diego. Do not leave here without ordering the corn nuts, kale salad, Mac and cheese...forget it, just order everything! Then Sam, the manager, came over to see how we enjoyed our meal, and was clearly the kindest and most sincere of his kind. Everyone here is amazing and the food is to die for. Get here IMMEDIATELY!

Our family loves going there. They are extremely helpful, have great prices, and kid friendly. They have a little kid section with a tv and toys to keep little ones occupied. Very knowledgeable. I don't feel intimidated or embarrassed because they are so personable (I have a lot of questions being a beginner). It's kinda a drive for us but since they are willing to take the time each visit to educate us, the gas that we spend is well worth it!

The only reason this restaurant is getting one star is because I do think they had a fantastic French silk pie!! But at this location the management staff is absolutely horrible and very unprofessional! I've never had this bad of an experience at village inn! We waited over an 45 mins for food. The pancakes came out burnt, the crpe was very bland and the texture was horrible. Another member of our party had all you can eat fish sticks but couldn't receive a second order because we would have been waiting over an hour. I desperately wish I would have taken pictures to show how bad the food looked, however our party was so shocked and tried to show the management how this was unacceptable. They were obviously overwhelmed by the amount of people that were complaining. It seemed like every table in the restaurant wanted to talk to management.

Shout out for Sebastian who helped me tonight by providing excellent service, fresh churros, and even let me order a last minute taco supreme at the window. Super nice guy! Thank you, Sebastian! I will be returning.

They forgot that they are in the service industry.  I stayed there for a 3-day business retreat that was being held at the hotel.  The dcor is nice and what you would expect from a hotel of this class but the service didn't come close to matching.  

As a result of weather delays, I arrived a day late and missed the 1st morning of meetings so when I finally got to check-in, I was in a rush.  While standing in line at the front desk, I checked in on the phone app.  This meant I only had to show my ID and receive my card keys.  While checking in,  there was a notice that housekeeping services would only be every 4th day.  While I don't really care about having my room cleaned, I'm no slob and I only slept there, I did want my bed made daily (not sheets changed, just made) and I meant to mention it to the clerk.  Unfortunately, by the time I got to the desk, I forgot and no one brought it up. 

Later that afternoon, after my meetings concluded and I had a chance to shower, I called down to the front desk to request that my bed be made.  I was told, in no uncertain terms that they would not accommodate my request because of the Pandemic (of course there is no evidence of transmission from soft surfaces like cloth or why would they ask us to wear face coverings?)

The next day, while in meetings, I found out that one of my colleagues was getting daily service so that afternoon I called to speak to a manager.  He told me that it was too late in the day to get it done but he would have it done the next day.  Since it was mid-afternoon, I replied that was unacceptable, I had asked for the service the day before and was lied to that it wasn't available and I expected it today, he refused stating housekeeping had already assigned the rooms for the day.  After getting off the phone I stepped out of my room and ran into a housekeeper.  I asked her, she checked with her boss and amazingly, they were able to accommodate me.  

Not only did the desk manager not even try to accommodate me, but he also failed to have the service set up for the following day.  This was an epic service failure that I would expect from a mom and pop.  I've received better service from Best Westerns.  I would never stay here by choice.

Your typical tourist trap at the end of the pier with mediocre food, service and good views. 2.75 Stars. 

First, as with any tourist trap, be prepared to wait. There is very little shade if it's a hot day so keep that in mind. The actual restaurant doesn't have that much seating either so even if there aren't too many people, chances are it will still be at full capacity. 

The service was mostly adequate. Had to try hard to get their attention a few times and they weren't very attentive and never cleared our plates despite barely having any room for them. 

The food was... disappointing. We had the local crab, baked garlic clams, pasta with clams, and the uni (sea urchin) with scallops. 

The crab was just OK. It's definitely no King Crab but it isn't even close to Dungeness Crab either. Ironically, didn't taste all that fresh. It was easy to get the meat out so there's that.

The baked garlic clams were probably the best dish. They were packed full of flavor and I'm sure the breadcrumbs, garlic, and Parmesan helped cover any imperfections and possible lack of freshness.

The clam pasta was... atrocious. I've had better pasta from frozen microwave dinners. Calling this pasta is offensive to Italians! Needless to say, we only ate the seafood and left 90% of the "pasta" untouched.

The biggest disappointment, however, was the uni with scallops. The scallops were actually pretty decent. Barely noticeable mild oceany flavor. The uni was.... come on! This is Santa Barbara Uni in Santa Barbara. Shouldn't get any fresher than this... but unfortunately it does. Sure, it was creamy and sweet but it was just off.

But hey, maybe you come here for the amazing views! Which, mostly they are. But the inside seating with the dirty windows leaves you with less than a stellar views. It didn't help that the seafood smell was mixed in with smell of what I would assume was bleach or some other cleaning material. The outside view is great, expect for when it's a warm day and you are cooking harder than your dishes.

Overall, I'd skip this place. There are much better seafood restaurants in the area.

The poor reviews are nearly all lies.  I've been going there for years and Oz has more and more attractive dancers than any other in Pinellas county.  Only club in the Tampa Bay area that has more and better is MONS Venus in Tampa.
BTW the buffet is free.  NOT $5!  
Private dances are cheapest in town, if you do the hourly BOGO _ 2/$35.
There are cameras everywhere, so extreme intimate contact is rare.   Still jizz happens.

Place has decent food, cold beer, plenty of TVs and the staff not hard to look at. 
But.......beware they will get you by padding the bill. Order 2 beers, they charge you fir 3 or 4. Add an extra 0 to your tip amount. Guess they hoping your drunk enough when the bill comes that you won't notice or just pay it anyway. If you go, always look at your bill and save your receipt. Better yet pay cash, or go someplace else.

Overall: pretty good seafood. As with all seafood, a bit pricy, but compared to other seafood options around, price point was decent. Wait was decent. 

Came here during a November weekend and really enjoyed the food. Grabbed food to-go since the dine in wait was long and sat at the near by tables on the pier. Tried: uni+scallop, clam chowder, lobster bisque, their local box crab, and lobster roll. All food was really fresh and left me wanting more even though I was stuffed! On another visit, I tried calling beforehand to see what fresh seafood options were still available for the day, but it seemed that they were busy and let the phone ring unfortunately. 

Would recommend to those visiting Santa Barbara!

I am VERY HAPPY with the service, professionalism, knowledge and the prices of this store.  I was looking for a stove, refrigerator and ventilation fan.  I ended up buying all 3 appliances from them. I was looking for a clean modern look.  I loved the SS appliances that the salesman recommended.  They were so knowledgeable on what was out there.  I had never heard of Fisher & Payk (New Zealand) before and love the European look of the refrigerator.  It looks  great in my kitchen.  And I picked Bosch stove and ventilation fan...LOVE them!
0 stars. I have called them on 3 separate occasions with the same issue. They are absolutely worthless.

I had been wanting to stop and try this place from the first time I saw it opened. Finally, I made time to go have lunch. I ordered the veggie crepe. I was impressed with the flavor of the crepe as well as the abundance of veggies. I was not happy with the service. For a new establishment the person at the register was not very friendly or helpful.  I felt like it was a bother for her to wait on me. Maybe a bad day for her, but lasting impression on me.

Food: 3.5
Decor: 3
Ambiance: 3
Service: 4
Value: 5

Very reasonably priced BYOB, but atmosphere and food are just okay.

Very satisfied with my food.    I had the chicken avocado wrap with ranch dressing.   Best ranch I've had in a while.    Hubby had a burger.   It was a nice size and cooked they way he requested.   Overall a very nice lunch experience.   Will definitely come back.   Atmosphere is nice and cozy.

Ray-Bans got butchered.  A pair of Wayfarer sunglasses had a clean break at the hinge.  I brought them in for repair.  The frames are melted where he attempted to reattach the hinge, and the repair isn't flush.

The place is really secluded and private. It's nice. The only problem was that the place smelled like old people. Not to be rude but it was only older people there. But everything else was GREAT. The food was awesome and me and my mom had a good time.

Boo to the people who think this is too sweet.  It's a CUPCAKE people!

I have been searching for the perfect cupcake all my life, and this is close to it.  You can taste the butter and the sugar in the icing (not just the lard/shortening like too many oversweet flavorless cakes).  Cake is moist and tasty.  OMG the Drew Brees is so good - chocolate cake and buttercream icing!  (also: who dat! :)

They do minis too which is my absolute favorite to bring to a party but you usually have to order ahead for those.

While you're there, pick up an awesome tee at dirty coast next door.  

Only downside: limited hours.  I wish you guys were open on a SUNDAY! What gives?

I love Seasons! Everything are so goodd BUT service needs more work! Ordered an Ice green tea with mixed jelly and small shaved coffee to go and took almost 30mins. My shaved ice was ready but waiting to get notice by the counter if I didnt bother to have my order followed up, could have taken forever.

It's so hard to rate these individual places at sparkman wharf since it's really just the food your reviewing. 

There was a little bit of a wait to put my order in, but the young lady behind the register was very polite. She helped me decide which oysters to go with. I don't like mine too fishy or too big, so I'm glad the ones she recommended were small and delicious.

Once you place your order there is a bit of a wait to get tour food. This isn't a bad thing because you know your food is fresh and the oysters come directly out of the shell. However, they are a bit pricey I feel and I don't think the quality is worth the price. 

Overall, if you want something small and on a date night at sparkman wharf I say why not?
We were here for a Christmas Eve dinner after picking up family from airport.  Wonderful food, waiter and atmosphere.  Parking was easily accessible.
This place is the absolute best. Great customer service, even better food. GET THE CRAB RANGOONS!
I got the full service wash - it's was sparkling clean inside and out in 15-20' . Nothing like getting in an immaculate car.

Them greens And beans AMAZING !!! Love it vegan soul food bomb didn't try anything else but what I did have was soooo good Mac wasn't the best but I've never had vegan food so tasty and seasoned sooooooo well

I wanted to like this place so bad, but I can't :(
Our service was sub par. You can't do substitutions, which made me a little disappointed because I would've preferred hash browns instead of pancakes but as our waitress said: " That just isn't allowed.." okay fine that's alright. But then I witnessed one of the servers touch and flip over someone's pancakes that just came out ready with her bare hands before taking them to her guests.. I AM VERY CONFUSED. Especially during Covid this made no sense to me and seemed very unsanitary. Additionally the floor was extremely slippery & I almost fell walking to and from the restroom. I'm not sure guys. The food was tasty but service says so much & this just wasn't it.

Outstanding buying experience. We just purchased a new Corvette from Ferman Chevrolet and it was a truly exceptional experience. Tommy Farrugio handled the transaction flawlessly. A year ago we bought a Colorado pickup truck from Ferman and it too was an exceptional experience. We've now purchased four new vehicles from Ferman since 2006. In each case we've  been very well satisfied. The Colorado we purchased last year has performed wonderfully. With the Corvette, Mr. Farruggio carefully explained the electronic features of the vehicle. The car is truly a technological marvel and is a super car in every sense of the word. The Chevrolet Corvette matches or exceeds the performance of European or Asian cars costing thousands of dollars more. Spectacular car and great service - that's a combination that is hard to beat.

Stopped by on the way home from dinner.  Nice looking space and welcome addition to the historic 'hood.  Great drinks.  Friendly and attentive bar staff gave us a peek at the menu, which looks small but appealing.  Looking forward to becoming a regular.

Best Sushi in Nola proper. High quality fresh fish. Good service. Also delivers, but I opt for cooked food instead of sushi for delivery for obvious reasons. I love hole in the wall joints and this is a top notch one, no frills just good eats. Habachi isn't cooked at the table so don't come lol king for a show, sushi presentation is decent but it's the quality and price that keeps me coming back. Try off menu items like the hamachi Kama for a treat and don't forget to order fresh wasabi for your sushi(once you've had the ground root you can forget about that horseradish stuff).

IT has a beautiful exterior and that's all I really got to see. I played in the fountains in front of it and I must say that is a beautiful add to make this area even more serene. I'd like to go inside to tour it since I know this place is very old and historic, and ideally if I could I'd like to visit the top of the tower to get a good view of downtown Philly.

My first experience here was just grabbing a slice of pepperoni during Mardi Gras.  It was so good that I just couldn't wait to go back there.  When I finally did they gave me a free order of garlic knots just to try out with my slice of pepperoni pizza.  Since then Epic has been a staple on my list of go to-pizza places.  Their pizza really is that good.  The garlic knots themselves are delectable and my wife fell in love with them.   They're also directly next door to I-tap, probably the best draft beer bar in St. Louis.  

That said...the service at Epic has dropped with each subsequent service.  We've always explained that we were planning to eat at I-tap and this initially was not a problem.  They would always bring it right over to us.  Now we've been dealing with an older male, not sure of his name, who is very gruff and short.  He seems annoyed just by your presence in the establishment, especially once you mention I-tap.  However usually a woman, in glasses, brings over our garlic knots, which we get out first.  Then she also delivers our pizza to us.  By contrast she is very friendly and polite.  

With all that said...my wife and I decided to hit up I-tap and Epic this past Sunday evening.  There was a younger, short haired blonde girl working at the time we walked in.  We thought we were in for a refresher from the usual grumpy service we'd received of late from Epic.  We received almost exactly the opposite.  We explained at first that we would be eating it at I-Tap and asked to get our garlic knots out first.  She stated to us "that they go in at the same time so I'm not sure they will make it out beforehand."  This has never been a problem in the past and we've always gotten them out at least 5-10 minutes before our pizza.  We went along with it though, thinking things may not be different than in the past.

Well things were very different.  She brought over our large pepperoni pizza and the garlic knots, and smugly stated "that the pizza wound up coming out first anyways."  Which I find impossible that a pizza can cook faster than it takes to throw the garlic bites into a fryer.  The garlic knots have absolutely zero garlic butter on them at all.  We are talking bone dry.  So my wife had to get up to go over there and ask for a side of the garlic butter.  

I could maybe understand any of this if Epic was busy.  However there was one other family in the restaurant that already had their food, so it's not like they were getting bogged down with orders.  

Let me state that I get that it must be frustrating to have a place like I-tap next door so nobody purchases their beer.  Let's look at the facts though..they aren't even offering any good beer!  They offer up the crappy Inbev special of Bud selections!  Why should I even entertain the idea of drinking that beer?  

Secondly...my wife and I tip at least a full 20% share every time.  Not that this means you have to give me great service, but at least be courteous as I'm giving this to you before you even have provided any service to me as the customer.  If they really wanted to they honestly could ask us to come pick up the pizza in x-amount of minutes and we would be glad to do so.  I don't think they should expect the same tip for this service, but if they are truly annoyed to be doing business as they currently do...they could switch to this model. 

I honestly do love Epic's pizza, but this sort of service may have done it in for me.
Great place to stop for a beer and something to eat, while waiting for a train back to CC.  The Pork Gui lettuce wraps are excellent!

A very different mexican food. We ordered - #6, with chile and cheese (Delish!), #4 with pork (good), chilly relleno with cheese (BEST), tamales pork (ok but the fish tamal looked better over sauce). I loved it but husband not so much.

This place was goood. I was in Nashville for a friend's bachelorette. Since planning meals for six girls and a gay guy in a new city across the country is a hit or miss situation, I took to Yelp and open table, chose places, and crossed my fingers and toes. I did good and got bridesmaid points by choosing The Old School. We talked about the damn meal for the rest of the trip. Some of us probably dreamed about it. I know I did.

We went for brunch and everyone was very impressed. That says a lot since we have a variety of nice brunch options at home. We ordered so much we could barely move. Everything was amazing. The best way to put it is this: you've never had eggs and bacon in your life until you've had freshly harvested and slaughtered eggs and bacon. The food is just different. The ingredients are all fresh from their farm and the texture is amazing. The donuts are fluffy pieces of heaven to die for. It's ok to have beer with breakfast because they make beermosas. Vacation carbs don't count. Order the pastry board.

It randomly snowed that morning so we couldn't see the animals that are fated to go into the menu. The outside atmosphere is so cute. The building is so rustic, the grounds are very pretty and quaint, with old schoolhouse picnic benches surrounded by gardens from which the vegetables and herbs are harvested from. Just with that experience alone, you immediately forget that you ate Wilbur's delicious cousin. Probably won't be back soon, but I definitely recommend this place to anyone in Nashville.

Seriously poor customer service to not serve free water. Or allow customers to bring in there own water. Charging .99 for a bottle of water is insane. A lot of people do not drink soda or want a surgery drink. 
Your food is already overpriced as it is.

Dog friendly on the patio! This delightful restaurant served us cold water and our dog a bowl of fresh water straight away! The covered shady patio is comfortable with fans and a nice view. 

Great local beer selection and cool cocktails. 

Food selections from salads to pizza to "two handed sandwiches" including one of the best burgers I've ever eaten. The service was OUTSTANDING! We got the salad with hot chicken and it was delicious! A must have! The burger was also outstanding. One mushroom burger and one All American. The fixings are fresh and tasty. The fries are great. Also got the mac and cheese--sooooo good. 

We all loved our delicious food, were all able to find something on the menu that we wanted, and all around really enjoyed our experience. 

A must do in Nashville!!
Great service and a good meal. I really loved the chocolate bread pudding. I would definitely return.

Holy crap! What a wonderful culinary experience. The biscuits r outta this world and the wait is almost NONEXISTENT! We had 7 people, came in during peak hours, and we had almost no wait time after we ordered. AWESOME!
Just amazing! The food was absolutely perfect! You've got to make a point to come visit this place! The people here were fantastic as well. It's the ultimate New Orleans experience.

Worth the uber and the hour wait. The Maple Leaf bar next door was a good place to get a drink while we waited. The cornbread they place on the table is actually amazing. We had the rabbit appetizer (very good) the fried chicken and the cajun boulibaisse (spelling?). Everything was delicious.

Our first and last time here. Not enforcing social distancing, staff not wearing masks correctly, and an EXTREMELY long wait to even order drinks, let alone receive our food. Tables sat unbussed. Seemed very understaffed and hectic. People weren't served in any type of real order. Missing part of the meal once it finally did make it to the table and the corned beef hash was spoiled. I do NOT recommend coming here. They said it was because it was Sunday so things were busy...but they were severely understaffed. We paid and left before we finished our meal.

I honestly do not understand the low ratings. I have had FANTASTIC experience with Health Advocate! I am SO THANKFUL my employer chose them. I have had it for over 9 years and I have been able to get Medical, Psychological and other referrals, medical advice, AND I have been able to talk directory during crisis times to a live therapist; each time they have been extremely helpful, patient, understanding and gave me what I needed. I have an incomplete spinal cord injury and my wife has an autoimmune disorder, chronic pain, and clinical depression. So this service has been invaluable.

Their clothes, colors and styles are wonderful. My daughter and I were thrilled to find such a store. The prices are very fair, in our opinions. The low star-rating is due to the rudeness of the people who work in the store. Being aware of the time and the desire to make several purchases my daughter asked upon entering what time the store closed and was told 5:00. We had arrived before 4 so expected no problem. At approximately 4:20 they began turning off lights. At 4:40, one woman working there announced loudly that "she (referring to my daughter) has been in there (the dressing room)for an hour and keeps coming out for other clothes". I don't believe that she realized that I was with her. My daughter bought about $400 worth of clothes, which we did think that that's what the store wanted people to do! We left at 4:50. 

But unbeknownst to them, they lost big on this sale!  My daughter is very well known in her field and could have been a wonderful asset to them. You see she has 1.3 Million followers online on one account and 316,000 on another. This young woman grosses over $20,000 a month and has done so for several years. She WILL be asked by her followers where she got these clothes. Sadly, after this treatment, she won't mention the name of the store. 

All of this to say, to this store and others, don't under-estimate these young people and their abilities to influence thousands. And don't be so quick to dismiss them. You may not be aware but these young people online are changing the world. They deserve the same respect that you offer to older shoppers.

My dogs used to be so fearful of the vet! At some point, he stopped walking through new doors because he believed it was the vet. We knew villa rosa was right for us! The waiting room is very cute! They have snacks for your dogs and yourself! Also, the staff and Sr. Esposito is extremely nice! She cares and listens to your concerns about your dogs! My dogs now like going just to see her! I don't know how to tell Parker that Dr. Esposito is not his girlfriend!  Never seen either dog happier visiting a vet before.

Day two after getting a full set, one fell off. Day 3, had it replaced. They for some god forsaken reason they didn't have the same color. I had to get a new color. Charge $20.00. Up $100.00 not including tip. 
Day 4..... 3 flipped off  wth! 
Day 5, what am I going to get charged now & will they be able to find the same color? 
Irritating..... Never in my life of having acrylics has this ever happened. 
Tomorrow is my b-day, I wanted to look nice. 
So frustrated.....

I was looking for someone to appraise some rings for my aunt's estate and found Angela Noble through a Google search. After calling several appraisers, I decided on Angela because she described her process with such passion and intelligence. She really knows the business, has high tech appraisal instruments and wants to do the best possible job for her clients. Angela's pricing is very fair and the printed appraisals she provided were exactly what the estate required. Her office was easy to find and I felt secure leaving my aunt's jewelry overnight to be appraised. Ms. Noble is very conscientious and accommodating, and kindly answered my numerous questions about the process. I will definitely hire her again.

Carne asada. That is all. 
 
Ambiance - More of an upscale restaurant with plenty of seating. 
 
 Service - Efficient and friendly especially since we were very indecisive. 
 
 Food - Had some of the appetizers but the carne asada was hands down so so good. Tender and flavorful with enough to share between two people. 
 
Overall, more of an expensive place to eat, but it's good food if you're looking for a nice date night.
We weren't disappointed by this restaurant. Started with Jalepeno bacon rangoons. Delicious! Split a wedge salad and pepperoni pizza.

Came here with a buddy on a very busy night and were able to find two seats at the bar. The hostess warned us about a potentially long wait for food but we decided to stick it out. As soon as we sat down we were greeted by the bartender, Cerbi. As a bartender and server she was perfect. Attentive but not overbearing. She would chat with us when we wanted and leave us alone when we didn't. Professionally one of the best fine dining bartenders I've encountered. We started with some delicious pints of local ale, Barrio Blonde. Then we asked our bartender for some app suggestions. Within 15 maybe 20 minutes we had our appetizers. THE BEST PORK BELLY EVER! You must order this dish! When our apps arrived we order our entrees and got those about 20 minutes after finishing app completion.  We tried the house special pork saltimbocca and the alaskan halibut. Both were very nice! I was craving scallops all night but my friend wasn't into scallops so I'll have to come back by myself for those as they looked amazing! Finally we finished with the cannoli dessert! This was incredible! I don't even like desserts but this was devine! I dunked them all up in my Irish coffee! So good! Can't wait to come back! You need to "treat yo self" and have dinner here. I love eating at the bar but the dining room looked lovely as well. Great date spot I assume especially with it being in the resort with a great view.

I'm shocked I haven't written about the Institute, because I've been here tons of times.  

There's a lot to like about this bar:  It's close to work (for me).  It's got a chill atmosphere and is never too crowded.  The beer list is good.  The happy hour is every day of the week and features $2 off drafts and half priced apps.  Most importantly, the Institute is always improving.  The bar has expanded along with the number of draft lines, and the kitchen has always been experimenting and getting better ever since they started serving food.

I also finally had dinner here, and the burger is delicious.  I'm pretty judgmental when it comes to cheese burgers, and the Institute was impressive.  It was perfectly cooked to order, the meat was juicy and flavorful, and the toppings and bun are good quality.  All of these are essential for a great burger.

I'll continue to hit up this joint and look forward to seeing how they improve.  Maybe Quizzo?
Phone 2 months old.  I sit down and the screen cracks.  The manager wouldn't cover under warranty.  I lost $150 Apple lost thousands of dollars in future business.  Way to go Apple Store
We got pizza to go from here on recommendation.  We thought it was really good. They were quality ingredients and the crust was crispy.

This place is an adorable house in Greenwood that specializes in wine and Italian-esque food. In the summer, you can sit outside, under a gazebo, if you're lucky to score seats. The service is slightly slow, but perfect if you're just wanting to sit back, drink wine, and eat food. 

We ordered the goat cheese and caramelized onion pizza with the baked brie as an appetizer. The appetizer came out fairly quickly, but our pizza order apparently got lost. The server informed us and gave us a free appetizer while we waited, which was awesome. The brie was amazing, but I love brie so I might be biased. It came with a blackberry jam, which complimented the cheese nicely. The pizza was just okay. I wouldn't order it again, but I'm curious to try other things from the menu. Overall, good first impression of this place. I'd love to come back to drink more wine and try some other foods.

Trestle Inn has a nice, warm feeling to it with the retro-sih music and projector of old school music videos in the front room. I stopped by on a Friday niight...there was a $5 cover around 11ish. There is a front room with high tables and bar seating that leads to a back room where the dancing (magic) happens. There was also a go go dancer in the front bar. The was an intimacy that I enjoyed in the front space. The bartender made a couple good whiskey sours and the beer list is solid. Trestle Inn is a nice little spot tucked away on the corner that's worth checking out.

This place gets 5 stars for being the best restaurant option within a 20 minute driving radius.  We have been here about 5 times and it has been great each time.  I have tried the Pho Tai which was flavorful and filling.  Lately, I have been getting the Bun with grilled pork and fried springrolls which is also very tasty.  I like to order the pork and shrimp spring rolls as a starter and wash everything down with a refreshing coconut juice.  After living in the Los Angeles area for about 5 years, I can confidently say that the Bun and Pho at Pho 63 is very comparable to those of some of the better Vietnamese restaurants in LA.  Prices of the menu items are really reasonable, with most entrees in the $7-$9 range.  The restaurant is always very clean and is rarely busy.

I finally got to try Seoul Fried Chicken the other night, and I think my mind is blown. I went for the five-piece combo with original chicken, slaw as my salad, and the corn fritter as my side (as opposed to fries). The chicken was crunchy and extremely juicy, while the slaw was fresh and had lots of hearty carrot in it. I loved the corn fritter, which was served in a milky, sweet liquid. I did not find the chicken too greasy, and the price point was great. The place is rather small with most people doing take out. You might have a hard time finding a seat if you want to dine in during the lunch or supper rush.

What a beautiful shiny new store! The layout is organized and pretty easy to maneuver. It's clear what department you're in. There's a cool variety of merchandise to choose from. The styles range from teen casual to business appropriate clothing. In addition to clothing and accessories, there's also a section for items in the home. 

A big difference about this store, compared to the location in West Edmonton Mall, is that there's an upper (for women) and lower level (for men). There are a couple of escalators inside this gigantic store. There's easy access into the store, from inside and outside Londonderry Mall.

This is a cool, hip, modern, and edgy store based out of Quebec. There's a range in prices you'll find here. If you look hard enough, you can find some discounted items. Check it out if you have a chance!

What an amazing venue! So moody and sultry. If you are trying to set the mood for your event this is the spot! With an amazing staff, a room that speaks for itself and versatility this venue will fit everyone wants needs and desires. They have indoor and outdoor seating options making it where they can accommodate for intimate settings or a larger gathering! You get the best of both worlds here.
Great service, even better coffee! The management however.... But the baristas work super hard.

This hotel is an absolute gem. Incredibly friendly and helpful staff, superb food in all of their restaurants/cafes, sweet rooms, and a fantastic swimming pool and outdoor bar. Icing on the cake was the pool party with DJ on Sunday afternoon. I've traveled to hotels all over the world from one star to five stars, but this hotel is probably the best I've ever been to for the money. Could not recommend it more highly. I will certainly return.

Loved the toasted ravioli appetizer. The meat in it was superior quality as opposed to what you would find off the shelf or other places. Great filet. Probably would not order the carnivore potatoes again. Stephanie was great!

I was shopping in Green hill and wanted mediterranean food. I saw Kalamata's restaurant and pull in. I'll give this restaurant a five star it's small plane,excellent wait staff. Food to savior. I ordered Lentil soup, today's special which was my Mahi-Mahi made to order(When I order fish I asked for it to be a little less cooked) (there is nothing worse than over cooked fish ) Greek salad and a garlic knot. I asked for hot sauce for my soup. I'm addicted to spice. Kalamata make their own. It was so very good. If ever in green Hills area give this restaurant a try. You will savior the taste all day.

The outdoor sports experience, the tree, the activities, the cars, the minigolf. Hands down the best outdoor experience at a Children's museum - period, end of story. I had really hoped the interior would have matched up, it did not. It was nice but was not nearly as exciting inside as it was outside - still very good.

I called to schedule a haircut. They canceled on me twice. I was more than happy to just get a quick trim and leave with my hair wet. I work 2 jobs. My entire team at work rescheduled their lunches for me to go this appointment they scheduled at the last minute. 
JC Penney is one of the few salons that pays hourly which is great for hairdressers to build a clientele, but doesn't motivate stylists to work with multiple clients or keep their appointments.

This food is amazing, and the service is outstanding too! We had the pulled chicken platter which is a heaping portion of savory bbq chicken and two sides that are even bigger! The brisket is truly awesome - nicely blackened on the sides, juicy and tender and even pink, no knife needed! They will gladly give you extra sauce, we have enough for our own barbeque! The sides are huge, definitely for sharing. Green beans that were crisp and wonderfully seasoned, baked beans that will spoil you for any others, crisp, fresh slaw, crispy (yes, even in takeout) tater tots, creamy, luscious mac & cheese. We started with caesar salad, definitely enough for two, with nice crisp romaine and a great dressing and cheese and croutons. Oh, and the cornbread is moist, what a nice surprise! And just to show how much they care, good quality silverware, thick napkins, and reusable containers. They package everything separately so the tastes and quality stay apart and you can combine your own way. And they threw in some of those large peppermint candies! We will definitely be picking up again, probably with many friends! What a neighborhood gem!

Ok, so if your trying to go to dinner, and have it feel like you're in Nashville, this place is perfect. I have it 5 stars for the vibe and the food. Obviously a 5 star restaurant normally is a dress up nice diner, but seems how this is right off broadway st, I think it's perfect. Especially for the area. Their mac n cheese with chicken is absolutely killer. Their pizza is plenty big, and the BBQ pizza is great. Definitely try this place.

Best breakfast in Tampa Bay! Two fried Eggs, back bacon (cut in-house), authentic English sausages & baked beacons, black pudding, fried tomato & English loaf toast. 

Wash down with a cup of English tea followed by an in-house brewed pint & the English Premier League on the projector screen. Available 10am Saturday & 11am Sundays (opening times) to 1pm. 

One of the highlights of my week, simply amazing.

Beautiful quick fresh food, this place is a refreshing change in the community. Kids eat free on the weekends and the variety is wonderful. Walking in reminds me of a place you would see in nyc or Miami, thank goodness someone in north North Pinellas is thinking progressively about our food options definitely 5 stars, employees are very nice attentive and food quality is great.

I came here for the first time after the Italian Market Festival. If you are looking for a specialty olive oil and vinegar, better than what you can find at the grocery store, this is the place to go. They have at least 8-10 flavors of white balsamic, 8-10 olive oils and an entire wall dedicated to red balsamic. From savory to sweet any flavor you want they have it. Also sampling is encouraged with a great piece of Italian bread to dip it in. I will definitely be coming back!

Wow, just wow. We had an appetizer of Spanish Octopus. It was tender and melted in the mouth. Cooked to perfection. For our dinner we split the Wolffish Check special. It was amazing. They split it on 2 plates for us. Little things that make a difference. Finally for dessert we had the cannoli. Being from NY I'm a bit of a cannoli snub and this one was amazing.

I was craving edamame and dumplings! This little restaurant happened to be right around the corner from my hotel! Very peaceful and quiet! They were playing oldies and it was perfect. I ended up being the only person in the place at one point, and it was the most peaceful moment I've had to myself all week!! I just sat and enjoyed great food and service!! Give this place a shot if you're ever in Nashville!

Casey our waitress from last night was AMAZING. She made our night. The venue and atmosphere are great, but she went above and beyond to be super nice and helpful. She was WAAAYYY better than the other waitress that waited on us, so much so that we had our tab transferred to her and will certainly sit at her section if she's working next time we go there. Thanks Casey!!

Do not use this bank for an Indiana Mortgage. Jeff Elder the loan originator told us everything we needed to hear to get us in the door then couldn't provide anything he said they could.  Huge Waste of time, possibly unethical, incompetent, for sure careless.  Don't use this Bank in Indiana. We asked for our Jeff's supervisors number but he wouldn't give it to us.  Told us to call the Bank Owner, we did and two days later no call back. Called again today still nothing.  Terrible service. Don't use.
Dinner was pretty good. They were super busy, so our service wasn't great, but we understand. The calamari appetizer was good, a little over done. Both our dinners were delicious! We would recommend!

I came in with three of my friends March 31, 2021 and the Asian-American older man was being extremely disrespectful. I asked the young lady for a waffle cone and he came out of no where and started raising his voice with all of us. I did not disrespect him at all and they didn't have a clean workplace.

Love love Dutch bros. My favorite drink is the galaxy fish black tea with extra blackberry.  Omg so amazing. Definitely get that when you go. We also love the annihilator too.  I haven't tried very many drinks since their menu is humongous but will continue to try new drinks whenever I go.

I had neglected my yard for quite some time. Then the monsoons ...then the jungle....and I mean Jungle...
I found Jorge of Morales Landscapers on Craigslist and gave him a call. My call was returned immediately and hours later he was at my home for the estimate. This was a 1/2 acre of jungle with one dead tree and several palo verde suckers and WEEDS! I was quoted $ 270.00. 
The next morning Jorge and 4 crew were at my house at 6:00 am..busting a move!
This quote INCLUDES HAUL AWAY AND WEED SPRAY!  Jorge is a very hardworking family man and I instantly liked him and felt really lucky to have chosen him. PLEASE do not hesitate to use this company. I picked his ad over many others and now you don't have to...
He has all the heart, tools and know how to get the job done FAST! 
I forgot how much space I have in my yard!!! 
Call this company ....you won't be disappointed.

Food was decent but nothing to brag about. I liked the balcony on the second floor. You can look down on all the foot traffic but I never made it to the rooftop bar. The waiter was too slow in bringing the check and we sat with a table full of dirty dishes just waiting DoD him to bring the check for at least 30 min. I guess he was in the weeds that night.

This place is not fancy at all but they do great work.  I got a gel manicure for $23 which is much cheaper than I usually pay.   They had a large selection of colors and the nail tech did an amazing job.  It looks great and has lasted longer than any other gel manicure I have had.  I will definitely be back again!

Update,  the guy that is always there that runs the place was killing it today.  He was the only one in there handling order taking, preparation, and delivery by him self.  He did it all cool, calm, and collected.  Way to go DJ's!
No frills, simple design, AMAZING food! I am confused it's not more crowded. Best hot chicken in town. It's an old classic. Support Bolton's and not all the new nashville Tom-foolery.

It was pretty empty when I arrived so I had some reservations.  However, the waiter/bartender was very prompt and attentive.  I ordered the ribeye and it was good.  I wouldn't say it was the best I ever tasted but it was cooked to the appropriate temperature and had a good flavor.  I ordered the calamari appetizer and it was very good.  

The singer was Mandy Cook and she was fantastic.  I had to order both albums off Itunes after leaving.  

My experience was positive so I'll probably try the hotel next time I come to Nashville.

This is the worst tasted indian food.. they charge whole lot of money for nothing...went to celebrate my wife's birthday on Wednesday dinner. It was buffet dinner night.   They didn't have Manchurian for Manchurian dish...the taste was pathetic. Anyone who know what real indian food is, they will should avoid this place.

Amazing barbecue. Cute, homey atmosphere. Amazing service! Let me say that again.... Amazing service. ! 

I ordered the brisket platter with the fried pickles and cold slaw. HUge amount of food! Quality of meat was exceptional. Sooooo worth the price. Tasty! And the fried pickles! Perfection. Spears insteads of chips! The light coating was crunchy as was the pickle. 

Highly recommend!

Went 4 weeks from grand opening and was super busy-got our food fast and was good 
Went today and took 30 minutes to get our food and wasn't super busy
Very disappointed- family of 5 
Seemed to be in charge a Hispanic/Japanese lady seemed to not care when I asked what is your typical delivery time-30 minutes is quite some time to wait
Best Cheesesteak in all of South Philly!! Whether you live in Philly or are visiting you must add this to your bucket list!

I'm just sitting here waiting for my Hoagies (Banh Mi) and I decided to write a review. I've been going here ever since I was a toddler and it is still bomb dot com. Though it use to be $2 or something but Life. Don't hesitant to come and order yourself some OG goodness. The rules look old AF but the quality is all there. Legit the best Banh mi in Philly.

Ok this time i did order the alligator cheescake and you will lick the plate!!  Jacque himself was there walking around talking to guests and I thought that was cool.  I had the stuffed pork chop and it was amazing.  Rich in sauces, this is not light.  My mom had the grouper and it was really good and bf had mahi mahi with pistachio sauce, amazing.  They send out this corn bread with garlic that are to die for.  Honestly everything on the menu is $20 and up but worth it because all entrees come with a salad and 2 sides.  We too the trolley from canal street on St. Charles so it was great to see all the mansions and the Universities.

A surprisingly good little gem on the north side of town. I've been here both for brunch and dinner, although I can say that the dinner was the better of the two meals.
I got the lamb dish for dinner and was in no way. disappointed. I practically licked the plate clean. Also, if we could have, we would have taken home every stitch of table bread in that place. So good yummy!

Much better than the average Indian food.  Great flavors and spicing.  Good service and fair pricing complete a very good restaurant in an attractive setting. Have never been disappointed with selection, taste or presentation. Always made to feel comfortable and welcomed. Menu offers wide variety of choices.

4 words to describe it..."THIS WAS PRETTY BAD" soup was very greasy...had to order diet coke to wash down the grease...my friend ordered their signature house ramen...her face described it all...I ordered their so called whopper...which was disgusting...in addition...there was no excitement at the restaurant at all...they tried to say Irasemase!, but it sounded so lame...they offered hot green tea...which they charged...wasn't even freshely brewed at all...seriously...I knew it was bad idea when Ramen place was in chinatown...not coming back....ever...

It was a great little find on a simple summer getaway. Thanks yelp app!

We ordered a half dozen donuts, a bagel w/egg & cheese, another with cream cheese, a corned beef & cheese sandwich and I believe a coconut mocha frozen drink (can't really remember). Overall everything was good and the staff really knows how to handle a crowd as the line moved fairly quickly.

While I can't say anything in particular was outstanding, I can say it's a solid place to get your morning started!

2021 / 97
Shortn'Sweetseries
Terrible people skills!!!!! He obviously needs to work on treating potential buyers with a little more respect.
Great neighborhood restaurant with Center City feel.  A little pricey but being a BYOB helps balance out the cost. Worth a trip!

Donut ice cream sandwich with either salted caramel or rainforest flavor is soooooo good.

The warm of the donut and the awesome flavor is so good.

My daughter loved their cookie sandwich with strawberry ice-cream.

Need to try it.  We will be back many times for late night after dinner treats, winter or summer.

It is across the small street from chick fil a, on the other side of 86th Street from Wal mart

Have been taking our Aussie there 4 years now.  We love the fact that she doesn't even look back when we walk her to her kennel.  Her little nub is wagging as the girls call her and talk to her.  Makes us feel better about leaving as she really likes it there.  

Love the fact they have 3 playtimes all part of the kennel price.  The staff is willing to listen and do those little things we do to show our affetion to our babies.  Very reasonable price.  

The kennels have always been clean and smells clean where the kennel are.  

Looking forward to meeting the new owners.  They now have a website too.

Thank you for being so caring when we leave our babies,

Holly Rose's mom

this was our last meal in Nashville before we came back to Ny. it did not disappoint. I didn't get to try a burger since I was still full from breakfast. I did have side orders of fries (yums) and mac&cheese (double yum) it's also cool the waiters there also sing/play guitar on stage. it was a great last stop and very close to our hotel. great place to go after exploring the orpyland hotel with the gardens & not wanting to spend $$$$ to eat there.

I've been to Bridgestone arena before and knew it would be a special experience for my daughter! So I sent my 8 year old on a fun trip to watch a Preds game with her cousins. She was so excited to go to her first hockey game!! I packed her bag (small backpack because a little girl can't remember to keep a purse on her shoulder... and frankly purses are uncomfortable) with her wallet, extra sweaters, chapstick and a pair of p.j.s just in case the game ended late. When she finally got there her aunt sent me a very happy picture of her before entering. Now once she got in was an entirely different story. At the entrance she was asked to empty her bag and throw it away. They did tell my 8 year old who was now sobbing that she could walk it all the way back to the car and come back... how nice. However, that's unrealistic for a child who has hip problems to make the treck once. It was either she throw the bag away or go home (there were 4 other kids with her so home wasn't an option). So, a very sad little girl threw her bag away and sat at a Preds game with her belongings spilling over in her lap. 

Lastly, If she brought a purse she could have walked it in. I think it's a little unfair to boys/men who wouldn't carry a purse. I think your policy is very one sided and could use relooking at. Either you make it an all around fair policy of no bags or you check bags better. There is no reason for anyone to throw their belonging away especially if it's not on your policy online! Very disappointed in how you handled things.

ONE OF THE FASTEST AND BEST COSTUMER SERVICE! I love the food here. It was so delicious. It was my first time trying fried alligator and suggest you to try it from here! You will come back for more. I didn't wait for more  than 10 min for my food And it was a busy night for them. 1000/10. One of my favorite places to go eat! I suggest you to definitely try it

I moved from Long Beach , CA on 9-27-16 to Reno , Nevada.  United/Mayflower, all UNIGROUP. I had moth damage on their Mayflower trailer in the 8 days they had my belongings.  My High Value, 6 X9 area rug, which is valued at $3,500  was completely destroyed in that 8 day period.  They are now telling me, after sending an inspector to see the rug at my home, that the amount for my claim is $0.00.  Due to what the inspector said.  Very strange, that the inspectors(2 of them) said they had never seen any thing like that in their life. Mind you, they are cabinet and furniture repair people, and are not rug experts, so why were they sent?  I have proof that the rug had no damage prior to moving and I am taking this to arbitration.  I also find it weird that when I  called the inspector today, I get a voice recording saying they are closed for vacation for 3 weeks!! What store closes for 3 weeks? 

I have photos and documentation to support my claim. I will never use Mayflower, United or their agents, Golden Eagle.  I am beyond upset. This rug was in mint condition . Going to arbitration!!!!

Their business hours state that they close at 6pm.  Perhaps naively, we showed up at 5pm ready for an hour of range time.
