We were turned away because my shooting partner's attire was not within their policy. 'No tank tops, no short shorts". Ok. So we told them we'll go get a change of clothes and come back. It's now a few minutes after 5pm.

We return with the proper attire at approximately 5:30pm and the store is locked. I look inside and 2 employees are cleaning and ignoring me. Eventually a third employee appears, unlocks the door and tells me that they are closed. 

"I thought you close at 6pm?" I asked.
"Well, we stop taking our last shooter at 5pm. If you shot now, you'd only have like 20 minutes anyway."

"So why," I asked, "Didn't you tell us that when you turned us away, and we told you we'd be back with a change of clothes?"

He looked dumbfounded and said, "That wasn't brought up at the counter, sir."

No apology or anything. Just completely did not want our business.

These people are clueless. 

On a prior occasion, a shooting partner I brought was turned away because her shorts were too short. On both occasions, the staff told us, "the lady that owns the place is really strict."

No problem. I'll be shooting elsewhere from now on.

Last night we celebrated our Nephew and his new wife here. The service was impeccable. The food will have you coming back for more!!! We ordered two pizzas, the meatballs, calamari, lamb skewers and the octopus. Omg, thank you universe, freaking divine flavors and seasoned perfectly. This is a restaurant that has an open kitchen and absolutely zero need for S&P on the tables. 

In addition to the quality of product, we felt really special when the champagne toast arrived. We toasted the newlyweds and chatted the night away, drunk off of laughter and full bellies. Mind you, we still ordered and devoured the tiramisu and cheesecake.

You can tell that a lot of thoughtfulness went into the planning of this tapas style menu and kudos to the chef who created these recipes! As an added bonus, Johnny Weir was in town and enjoying himself and seeing his beautiful coifed hairdo while hearing laughter and convo bouncing off the ceilings, made for a delightful and entertaining evening. 

Make sure to make reservations! We will definitely be back whenever we find ourselves in the Wilmington, De area.

In these trying times where we can't look at each at each other except than through masks my friend and I were pondering where to go for lunch. We were both thinking pizza. At the same time we said remember Shakey's pizza? He said you know? It's now Boulevard Pizza, so we called and ordered a combo pizza. The staff was amazing. The service was amazing. The atmosphere was amazing but the best part was the incredible delicious pizza. Never have I ever had a better pizza. It was so nostalgic. It felt almost like the OLD NORMAL. Thank you Boulevard Pizza. Keep
Up the good work!!!

Had a massive amount of work that needed to be done on the passenger side of my car, and even before I dropped my car off it was obvious that Touch N Go was one of the best shops around. The owner was extremely nice and accommodating, doing his best to make sure my car was ready by the time I had to move back in to college. The car now looks better than it did before the damage occurred and the final price was an entire $1500 cheaper than any other shop estimate I took it to. 
Overall, Touch N Go is an excellent body shop that understands everything the customer needs, and exceeds expectations. Best shop in Hamilton County!
Friendly staff and a straightforward set of units. Easy accessibility. This is what you're looking forz

Once again Customer Service at its best. My husband ordered an arrangement for me and the next day some of the roses started wilting. He called them and brought a whole new arrangement.  This is why we use them every year. They are there for their customers.

It was my first time in Philly so obviously I had to try a cheesesteak. I wandered into Reading Station to scope what was available and noticed the fairly long line in front of Carmen's (~12 people). The sign said "cheesesteak" among other offerings so I stepped into line. I'm glad I did. 

The line moves a little slow but you get to watch the cooks chop up and grill others' hoagies inside their kitchen/booth. Definitely a good bit as it increases your appetite during the 10 minute or so wait to the register. Everyone was super friendly too. This can increase the wait time as they're willing to explain and offer suggestions for anyone unsure, so a good payoff. 

I got the classic with half sweet half hot peppers. The bread was amazing and everything else was perfection. Definitely will go to again next time I'm in town.

For restaurant week, I decided to come back to the restaurant that was so good, it inspired me to start yelping. Unfortunately, I came away more disappointed than the first time. But...I feel like I can't complain too much. I mean, it was restaurant week, so they were packed. And I got SO much food for $30.12. Let me summarize the pros and cons of this visit:

PROS: Exceptional service. They were busy, so I almost expected slow service. But not at all- we were seated right away and had two people waiting on us. Love it when the waitstaff take initiative rather than wait for someone else to take care of the table. The appetizers were delicious- chicken cheese pot pie had an amazingly flaky crust and love the cherries inside. Ox tail was also great. Desserts were semi-sweet, as advertised. Love the apple, pumpkin beignets were okay- probably wouldn't order it again. Generally, though, flavors were spot on.

CONS: The main taysts were disappointing. The lamb came out and half of my cut had the texture of meatloaf. The other half was fine, which made me think it was not on purpose. So I looked over at a neighbor's lamb, and it was also the consistency of ground meat. Is that right? My neighbor was also not pleased and complained about his lamb. The meatballs were dry. The textures of the meats were just not good.

It was a great deal. But I feel like Tayst can do better.

Delicious! Try the gooey butter cake cannoli and the expresso shot over gelato (comes with biscotti & whipped cream)!! So delicious. Just what we were craving. Not to mention, the guys behind the counter are amazing!!

Stopped in to get a break from the wind and rain. Was greeted by an employee and offered tea. I went with chia latte with soy milk which was good. My date had an americano which is their version of coffee. Everyone was eating gelato which looks very appealing and they have multiple flavors. I would definitely stop by again. Very nice atmosphere and employees were nice.

I had heard great things about Good Dog, and after seeing the triple D episode, I was really excited about trying it out. A group of friends and I stopped in on a Sunday afternoon, when the place was pretty empty (one or two other tables aside from ours). I loved the dog pictures on the wall!

We were seated directly under the air conditioner and were freezing, so we very politely asked the waitress if it was possible to turn it down. She glared at us and said, "That's the bartender's job, not mine." My friend then asked, "Oh, would you mind asking him to turn it down then?" She got really sassy and said, "Well, first of all, the bartender is a SHE. And fine" before she stomped off. I am all about gender equality and not making assumptions, but there is no reason to be so nasty about an innocent (and frankly, grammatically correct) error. I work in a hospital and am mistakenly called a nurse all the time, but I don't go around berating everyone for it. Maybe this waitress was having a bad day? But seriously, if you're at work, then act like it. 

Our food also took almost 45 minutes to come out (we were still shivering this whole time, by the way, because whatever the bartender did to turn down the AC did not work), and when it did, it wasn't mind-blowing. Maybe I had expectations that were too high, but our burgers and po boys were good but not amazing. The aioli for the fries was also pretty bland, though the fries themselves were pretty decent. 

Then I had to use the restroom at one point, and I got up to ask the waitress if it was in the back. She just stared at me like I was dumb and said, "Mhm." 

Honestly, I'm really disappointed. I was hoping to find a place I could keep coming back to for a good burger and a fun atmosphere. Even though Good Dog does have character, my experience there was pretty awful. I don't think anyone should have to put up with a hostile waitress for decent food - there are plenty of amazing restaurants in Philly that have a nice staff and delicious food for a reasonable price.

Had breakfast here today.  This place definitely sparked my interest by being one of the oldest restaurants in St. Louis.  It closes at 2 pm so you have to get there fast if you sleep in.  Had the Goody Goody Breakfast plate with eggs, sausage, grits, and pancakes.  Some of the white part of the eggs wasn't cooked all the way but they were still good.  The sausage is patty form and was wonderful when dipped in the eggs or pancake syrup, which is a sweet and savory type. The grits were omg unbelievable good, which the waitress gave me real butter packets for, and were very filling.  Nice portions on the grits!! The pancakes I ate last and by this time I was so full I struggled to finish my plate.  Definitely would go back again and the Goody Goody Diner was a very awesome experience.

We live in Manayunk and my fiance and I have driven by La Collina for years and always wanted to go. I checked the reviews extensively, and they're all really positive, so we decided to go. The service is VERY attentive, which actually was a bit of a turn off for me. They had us sit in the middle of the room although no one was there yet, which felt crowded even though the room was large. They do not give you a wine menu unless you ask (strange), and it feels rushed, the whole dining process. The food is honestly mediocre at best. I was really excited for the food, but it was poorly seasoned, mine came out on a plate with sauce that had been sitting but a super chicken entree, and the "side of potatoes and vegetables" was literally half a potato chopped up poorly with 2 wimpy pieces of broccoli. My fiance's meal was equally disappointing. I would never return here or recommend it. For the cost of the meal, we could have gone many other places, had a fantastic meal with amazing food and cocktails and better service and ambiance.

This is a great lunch spot, especially if you're looking to break away from your normal routine.  The food is delicious and the service is great!  It's a good value too.  You can continue spending good money on fast food, or you can spend the same amount and get quality food.  This is quality.  The do dinner too.
The staff here is amazing! Dr. Saira is great and takes the time to explain things. I love that I can typically get an appointment the same day that I call.

Our experience was amazing! We had a party of 10 and called ahead and were accommodated within the hour. The entire experience was A+. The staff was amazing, the drinks were delightful and the food was to die for!! We sampled a bit of everything and it was all delicious. Definitely coming back and will be recommend this place to friends.

Visiting fireside lounge 3days straight 
This place was what I've looking for and save reviews for me to revisit the lounge



Troy, was amazingly thoughtful about covid-19 and super nice, and make perfect drinks
Best donuts in STL! Moist and plenty variety! Also black owned!!! Two locations but the new one in the central west is closer than the downtown location. Both are terrific!

These ladies that work here are the best. We were able to grab a quick tasting while on the list for lunch. The wine and view was exquisite. I tried the rose and also Malbec . It's worth a visit while on Stearns Wharf. Enjoy. An added benefit is if you check in on yelp you qualify for a free taste of Chardonnay. Cheers!

I ordered wheels and tires from TireRack and had them shipped to T2Y. Martin and Jose are great guys!  Martin communicates frequently and Jose did a great job on the installation. They are my new go-to guy!  No more frightening trips to the tires store with before and after pictures of my wheels!

This dealership gives broken promises just out for numbers.  I asked the sale person about free oil changes on the vehicle quickly his response was yes.  Before signing the paperwork it was asked again about the free oil changes then he change to the first one is complimentary.  (not good the is the first lie). Also, installing the door guards was a MUST before I signed the paperwork he agreed to that too. At the time the vendor wasn't there to install it.  But the salesperson was going to get me an appointment.  After two weeks of waiting I decided to call the salesperson to see the status.  He quickly said he come over to my residence to install personally.  (never happen)  I called the salesperson again he claimed that the service department was suppose to contact me and he would give me a call on the status(never happen).  I decided to call the service manager which was no help.... he directed me back to the salesperson.  I texted the salesperson on the status he took my information and I'm still waiting.  I'm not happy with the service or vehicle that was leased. And still waiting for a call back. I would not recommend this dealership. I should have leased an Audi the deals was much better.

Don't go here. Bought a Groupon and spent 45 minutes arguing with Gene at the front desk about how they don't honor the coupon fully...tried to charge me an extra $38 on top of a $39 Groupon purchase. On top of that, informed me that I'd need to pay the tax for the service in cash because their system was down. Tax? Cash? What? It's Groupon! He blamed the holidays for his crappy attitude. Desire was very professional.

As good as food trucks get! I went here w/ a friend so we shared a couple menu items. She got the egg rolls and I got the chicken plate w/ slaw and coconut rice. Both had the most amazing flavor and were priced so reasonably for the quality!

The owner/employees were super friendly.  I'll definitely go back regularly.  Just check their Facebook page for daily location.
Probably the cleanest, nicest laundromat I've ever been to. Very friendly staff and they have WiFi!! The machines all seem new, the space is bright. Great find!

Sat at the bar, this time. Ordered steaks, sides, salads, no alcohol.
Two of us. Place was crowded.  Nearly every single seat at the bar was taken by a man with a logo on his shirt and a wedding ring on his finger..  
i'm guessing these were truck drivers away from home, eating at the bar, alone...

We were in the mood for steak and were trying to decide where to go.  Son was feeling thrifty and went through the different restaurants locally, for steak..  He settled on this restaurant because i told him i had eaten here before and the meat was good.

Got to the bar at 7:15. Didn't get dinner until about 7:40-7:45..
Got out at 9pm.
The wait time for food was long. 
Wedge salad came out and the lettuce was dead.. it had been dead for a couple of days, I'm guessing.
I ordered my steak MR. It came out seared on the outside and raw on the inside.  The grilled asparagus were cooked perfectly.  I wasn't charged for the extra bleu cheese dressing I requested for the dead lettuce.
Friend ordered rib eye with mac & cheese and a side of grilled shrimp and rice.  He didn't say anything bad about his dinner except that his mac & cheese was off.
When I tasted it, I gathered that they cooked up the pasta and threw some canned cheese sauce on it and called it a day...... terrible.
I got the little tiny bucket of dessert.. Brownie with a tablespoon of vanilla ice cream on top.
It was delicious...  so the asparagus and the brownie was delicious.  
The steak?  I brought it home. I'm going to cook it up with eggs, in the morning.
They offered to recook it for me, but it took so long to get dinner and dessert, I couldn't bare to think I would have to sit there another 20 minutes for my steak to cook more..
So with that.. I have tried this restaurant two times.
That's good enough for me.
I don't recommend it.
Another awesome meal at Sugarfire!  The brisket is my favorite but haven't had anything I wouldn't order again!

I was looking so forward to the Wine Fest!  I have gone the past two years and this year we were bringing others so they could have as much fun as we did.   I can't say we are going to go back next year.  

I understand the price of the ticket, $20.  I enjoy the little glass I get.  What I don't enjoy is standing in line an hour to get in only to be told "You should have bought a VIP ticket and gotten in earlier if didn't want to wait in line."  Wait, what?  

The Wine Fest has gone from people actually wanting to learn a little to those who just wanted to get drunk. I have several pictures from the event of people passed out on the lawn.  

It was a warm day so we needed to buy water.  Guess what, not all vendors can sell water, only a select number of vendors could - and they had run out.  Why would water be an item that every vendor can't sell?  I understand not wanting to have 50 pizza joints - but come on - we all need water.  

The tasting lines were terribly long with some people camping out at certain locations. 

Most vendors took both credit and cash.

The vendors who were selling products were pretty nice.  I enjoyed the variety of items that were available.  

The food trucks are always fun to sample and offer a unique variety of food to sample.

Save the frustration - take a drive to your favorite winery.  Mallow Run is only 30 minutes away.  Oliver is 45 minutes away.  Each offer a more relaxed environment.

The crispy pork bun are straight 

I opted for the Terakawa signature Ramen. The roasted pork belly was cooked to perfection and the boiled egg was delicious. The broth and noodles could've been better. I'll be back soon to give the spicy ramen a try!

Sitting in this restaurant right now. Just canceled the food order after waiting over an hour after ordering. This cannot be the busiest this place has ever been.  The chargrilled oysters we had were good. However, when after that you try to deliver the incorrect food to our table 3 tines, it's a problem. Simple orders, salad, gumbo, entree.  No excuse for a supposed established place.  Two stars only because the chargrillled oysters were good.

We came here on a Sunday with three of our friends. When we went inside to check the wait time, the hostess took my name and asked for my phone number, I was expecting a phone call when our table was ready, but they actually sent text messages with a link to an app that allows you to see where your place in line is which we thought was pretty cool.
The inside is really nice and clean. We were seated at a round table next to a fireplace with a huge skylight right over our table.
We decided to share an order of the OMG french toast as an appetizer. It came with three pieces of dipped whole wheat french toast topped with dollops of pumpkin cinnamon mascarpone, toasted pecans, caramel drizzle, and bacon. To be completely honest, I did not think that this french toast sounded appetizing at all - but I could not have been more wrong about it! The mascarpone was such a great flavor on the french toast, and the bacon added an unexpected smokiness to it.
I ordered the bandito burrito (tortilla with three scrambled eggs, onions, peppers, chorizo - it comes covered in cheese with a small cup with sour cream, and I opted for no salsa. It comes with a side of home fries and fruit). I really enjoyed the breakfast burrito, it was HUGE - I didn't think there was anything "special" about it per se, but it was done really well and I would be happy to order it again.
My husband ordered the big easy benedict (corn bread topped with avocado, creole seasoned onions, peppers, and chorizo, with poached eggs, and a cajun hollandaise. Maybe the reason I feel the way I do about the burrito I ordered is because I tried the big easy benedict - truly the best eggs benedict I have ever had. It is packed with flavor, and the corn bread pairs so perfectly with the flavor profile.
Our friends ordered the wilbur skillet (bacon, potatoes, avocado, diced tomatoes, cheese, and eggs your way), grande huevos rancheros (diced potatoes, chipotle peppers, chorizo, onions, black beans, cilantro, avocado, cheese, salsa, sour cream, and eggs your way), and the tuscany omelette (roasted red peppers, spinach, sausage, and mozzarella).
I didn't try their orders, but they all seemed to enjoy everything.
The reason I didn't give The Turning Point five stars was for a few reasons - we were told our wait would be around 45 minutes and it was over an hour and 3 of the five egg orders were incorrect. They had switched the egg orders on the huevos rancheros and the wilbur skillet (which we didn't realize until later that day), and my husband's poached eggs were very overcooked - they were basically hard boiled without the shell. 
Those things aside we will definitely be returning and I can't wait to try the corn bread french toast and their specialty hot chocolates!

I came here first during Sushi Smackdown (which was such a fun event--why can't I review that?) I liked it so much that I came back to this establishment once more--and that won't be my last time. I enjoy their creative sushi rolls (The Marilyn Monroll and the Bubblefish roll are favorites). They have a great tea selection which I really enjoy.

Charming atmosphere which is quintessential New Orleans.  Food was excellent and I do recommend the gumbo!  Our waiter, Clarence, was exceptional!  He was professional, respectful and kind.  A great experience and we can't wait to return...and will ask for Clarence!!

Welcome trippers! Make sure you stop and stretch your legs and arms from driving hours on the road. They have coffees, teas, coffee lattes, snacks, and yes, restrooms! Clean too! Oh, and most rest areas offer massage chairs, just like this one.

WE'LL BE BACK FOR MORE FALAFEL!

Thanks for a great meal last night! The falafel on a pita was amazing; I wasn't expecting it to be stacked with hummus, falafel, salad and tzatziki sauce! Hummus was delicious .. creamy, garlicky goodness. And the Persian rice really tasty. We'll be back.

They have a handful of tables to sit and enjoy your meal there but this seems like mostly a take-out place. Don't let that deter you since the food is delicious and priced right!

I have never try polish food before, after reading the highly remarks from other reviews,  I took 4 friends with me to have lunch there,  (they only serve breakfast & lunch).
the place is small, can hold 34 persons, One chef cook outside and anothe kitchen
behind in the back.  they are relatively busy, with only one waitress and they talk
with Polish language(I guess) with most customers.  I ordered Potato pancake and
a cup of carbage soup,   
The Potato cancake was hot, it burn my lip and my cheek,  because I was hungry
after wait for 52 minutes.  The soup was ok.
they are under staff, the chef and waitress have to take care the bills,  I am not
a friend of food handler touching the money.
I got stomarch ache after an hour.
My friend (Polish) with me said I would not like this kind of food, she knows it.
I like adventure, but this one do not go too well.

Walked in with 3 others in my party. Place wasn't busy at all maybe two other tables and now I see why. Food was not fresh even though we were the only ones there. Did take a long time to get it so maybe it just sat under a heat lamp and wasn't microwaved like we believed it to be. 2 out if the 4 of us got very sick

Best place in public market!  Quick, healthy and affordable lunches. Amazing pastries, artisan kombucha, and their energy bars are AMAZING! I drive all the way across town a couple times a week to enjoy this place.  They also have GREAT vegan options.
Staff and product are fine. But this is a tight cafe.  If you're going for a take out its fine. But this is a tough place to meet.

Super quick = less money out of my pocket. I'd say that's worthy of five stars. 

Not only were they fast, they were extremely organized and very friendly. You can tell they were experienced and had a system perfected for moving.

Came here for a nightcap or two after visiting The Royal Tavern next door. Loved the atmosphere in the place. When we came in, they were watching Talking Dead (I guess straight after watching The Walking Dead) which was fun to see - I like bars with a bit of community about them. You could tell the people at the bar were regulars and the bartender was a really nice dude. Couldn't quite believe the bar prices either - I'm always shocked when I get change from a $10 for two drinks, even AFTER the tip.

To the locals - go here if you want a new local bar.
To the outsiders - feel at home in this true dive bar.

We just moved in the neighborhood and tried this place. We were greeted with a smile and friendly conversation. We were recommended awesome local beers, and appetizers. We got brucetta that literally made me smile when I took a bite. We also got bacon wrapped jalapeos in some sauce that was just amazing. I have told several people about this place already and how wonderful my experience was. Our meals were just as amazing as the apps... I will be coming in often and unfortunately for me it's going to get expensive even with a great happy hour and daily specials. Also they have a discount for military, police others.

I have had Pinch a Penny S. Dale Mabry for approx 2 years. Any time there was an issue--green pool, low pressure, etc and I called I was greeted by an employee who not once said "I'm sorry, let me see what I can do about this". It was always my fault according to them. 
I have been watching the pressure on the pool for the last 3 1/2 weeks. It was way too high. The pressure in the pump was lousy. Even though the tag on the door said they cleaned the filter, it was apparent they did not. I took the top off the filter to verify. When I called today, an employee answered and said "how did I know the filter was not cleaned" . I explained that they had just been there today, in the past few hours, and the pressure was lousy, and I checked the filter and it was dirty. The guy said "well you should only clean them every 4 weeks". I asked if the filter is dirty shouldn't they clean them? He said yes. Not once did he say, let me send someone out there to take care of it. He continued to argue with me. I asked for a manager. The manager got on the phone. I told him the same story. He asked me how long the filter had been in there. I told him not very long. He continued to argue. I asked him,, why is it that everytime there is a problem, it is my fault, not Pinch A Pennys. He continued to argue with me. Then he said "if the service is so bad, why did we continue to have it for 2 years?". I said, maybe I am not real bright, but I am terminating my service, and do NOT charge me for the month. He said "are you threatening me" ? I said no, I said "Do not charge me for the month when you did not do what you were supposed to do". Liars, idiots, yes they are. I wouldn't have a bird bath cleaned by these people. Customer service--None. Accountability--None. Personality to deal with problems--Minus.
Great bar and amazing food. Love it here. Definitely recommend the spinach dip. Vibes are great

Went with a group of 5 adults. Service was great and food was fabulous with a great selection. We all ordered something different and everyone was exceptionally pleased. Kudos to everyone that made our meal great! Definitely going back!

Third strike. We gave them one more try but the Meatballs were undercooked and flavor was bland, almost store-bought/frozen-like. Sauce is sweet and runny if you like that.  Pizza is average but it's ready in the the window is you want a quick slice to go. Cheap prices make up for quality. Understaffed like everywhere means slow service.

I will never go back to Harbor seafood ever again ordered a seafood platter. I went to pick it up they gave me my food card came back about 10 minutes later tell me their credit card down and can I wait a few minutes. I said yes. After waiting 20 minutes they said The machine was still down and it would be a few more minutes more minutes OK another 10 minutes go by they come back and they said it's gonna be another 15 minutes. I said I'm sorry now I'm waiting here a half hour give me my credit card. I left and went to a different seafood place and it was ready within 20 minutes. Who knows come back up in 15 minutes already well over a half hour. Never again

I was looking for an authentic italian place in the new city and this place did not disappoint! Very cozy inside and the staff is extremely welcoming! Stop giving your money to box italian and come get the real thing. Ask for Erin!! She's so nice!

Outstanding! The food is delish. Prices are a bit high but you get what you pay for. It's a tight squeeze for seating call and make a reservation. A wonderful place for fine dining a celebration for every bite.

Arrived a few minutes before 2:00. Hostess/waitress didn't seem happy to see us. After she sat us with menus, she came back about 5 minutes later (2:04). I asked if they had any lunch specials because we got the dinner menu, she said (In a nasty tone) that lunch stops at 2:00, I said it is now 5 after and we got here before 2:00, she shrugged her shoulders and walked away. I noticed that the clock over the register is set about 15 minutes fast. If you go through that much trouble to stop serving lunch... Why serve it at all?

To be fair I started writing this review while waiting for my food and had given them 1 star. The food is a solid 4 plus.. But points deducted for bad customer service.

What a great place to have brunch!

We hit this place up with friends on the Saturday before Easter. Even though it was busy, there was ample space to sit and dine in peace. I didn't feel like I was rubbing elbows with strangers, like I often do at restaurants. 

On top of that, I was so pleased with the inventive and delicious mimosas! Strawberry and pepper! Grapefruit and winter spices! Flavorful balanced twists on a classic drink. We sampled them all, and you should too.

For food, we mostly stuck to the taco menu, though my husband departed and got the johnny cakes and fried chicken (which he enjoyed). Here's where the restaurant fell down a little bit. The tacos were composed almost exclusively of meat. Each taco had a generous serving of delicious meat, but only a sparse serving of other toppings, be it a single wedge of avocado, or a lone thin slice of jalapeno. I get it - it's BUTCHERtown Hall. It's about the meat. But even the bell of the ball needs a date to the dance. Of course the meat was delicious, but all of the tacos could have been enhanced by more toppings.

There were also problems with plating practices. If three people at the table order lamb tacos, a single plate of three lamb tacos comes to the table. Since everyone had ordered a smorgasbord of different tacos, keeping tabs on who got what taco was difficult, both for us and for our waitress. Three of our tacos didn't come out and we had to inquire about them. 

Still an overall enjoyable experience. Go to Butchertown Hall for an easy quiet brunch and order some incredible mimosas and meat centric dishes. Write down who had what.

The parish is my favorite place in Tucson. Steak salad and a glass of wine yes! I had a little birthday party here a while back and even though my friends were being annoying we were all coming and going they handled us with grace. Love the late night menu and great full bar.

One word HORRIBLE!!!
As locals we are always looking for a new place to eat. Found this place and seeing it was pretty affordable, decided to give it a try.

The waitress was very sweet and attentive, but the food was horrible. 
We ordered the falafel appetizer and 2 sandwiches. Falafel tasted a little burnt, but ok. The sandwiches were pathetic. there were maybe 3 pieces of meat in them and barely any vegs. The flavor was mediocre and not much flavor. We ended up having to order another appetizer to fill us up.

The kicker.... while we were eating my husband saw a rat run up a pipe in the kitchen. We told the waitress and got a half assed sorry and she walked away.  No manager came to the table to apologize or order any type of discount. In fact they kept looking at us, but never approached the table.

I will never go back and will be sure to advise anyone thinking of going to stay away.

Just had another burger & shake at "Charcoal's" on Saturday.

Getting better slowly.  Definitely worth a visit now.

The standard mixed chips which come with burgers are better than fries or O-rings.

Will keep reporting.

Rick
Had a crown replaced. Happy to say it was an enjoyable experience! Dr. Tanner and Alecia are awesome. Very professional with the latest technology.  Highly recommended!

it's in the garden district. it's well-known and easily extremely packed. we had to wait a half hour for a table, which was no problem because the area around this place is highly attractive to wander about, with its sprawling gigantic floor-to-ceiling window front facade houses and the like. shops in the area on a sunday don't seem to open until a closer approximation to noon, but it's sunday. people sleep. 

juices seemed on the pricey side (as much as a meal). coffee was good. the food was on the southern diner side, complete with the usual awesome biscuits. no frills. ketchup and tabasco and napkins on the walls to grab.

fresh, honest food. i didn't find it much different from some of the joints in bywater towards this end. maybe a tad more expensive (my tab was 16, versus a tab of around 13 in bywater). good enough.
My sales clerk was rude, condescending and unhelpful.  Will not be returning.

SOOOOOOOOO GOOD!  We waited a little to get our tables even though we had reservations but the manager was very apologetic and ended up taking care of us. ABSOLUTELY WORTH THE WAIT! I'm very picky about Italian food because nobody beats mom's Italian cooking but this definitely tops the charts! Can't wait to go back next time I visit Philly.

Really just meh for me, consistent with reviews I had received from friends but I wanted to check it out for myself. On taco night, the portions were meager for the price and tasted...I dunno...store bought? The service was kind of schizophrenic, vacillating between rude and extremely friendly/attentive. Made me feel rather uncomfortable. The decor is cute but in a contrived Williamsburg, Brooklyn kinda way. I do like the fireplaces, I think they're a nice touch. Not particularly inclined to go back but the views here are so polarized with some very positive ones that I would give them benefit of the doubt and try again...

OMG! These were some of the best wings ever. The place was busy, but not packed and the service was super friendly. Our waitress was pretty much running the place and never seemed too busy to take care of us first timers.  

The wings were crisp and not over sauced and the hand cut bacon/Cheese fries were hot and not the least soggy! 

Oh, did I mention what a great value WOB is? I know there's a popular chain people fawn all over. But WOB is local and dare I say....Better

The nachos were great, the mole sauce was not to my liking.  My better half ordered a chicken burrito with veggies expecting peppers, onions etc.  She got a veggies burrito with carrots, zucchini, and mushrooms!  Not what she was expecting, probably just a misunderstanding.  Would like to come back and try the tacos.

I'm not sure why this place had 5 stars it's terrible one thing that was good was the drinks but that's common in New Orleans we where excited for some good sea food what we got was trash . 
1. The service was slow waited 40 minutes for a appetizer 
2. The crawl fish Beignets were gross that like all sugar .
4. We asked for crab shell cracking tool and they said oh there all dirty . 
5. We ordered a platter it came out cold as ice even the sausage was bad. 
6.We told the waiter and he offered to re heat the food no thanks .
7. The managers response is there's a new kitchen manager and he's sorry ... he offered drinks we said no we are leaving and he still made us pay a small portion of the bill .... thanks for ruining our Saturday night vacation dinner
8. I'm from Cali we eat boiling crab often and this place isn't even remotely as good as biking crab it's shameful the sauce is watery and the seafood was cold if your a tourist avoid this place if your looking for "boiling crab type food "

This review is strictly based off of communication with Angela- I cannot speak to her services.
I was planning a last minute wedding, and contacted Angela given the Yelp reviews. She was extremely slow in correspondence, I.e., responding every 12-48 hours despite letting her know that my wedding was in a week.  If you're planning a last minute event and want a very quick response, probably not the best person to go with.

Unfortunately they have two whoppers for five dollars but they don't have the two impossible burgers for six dollars deal anymore. So I ordered one impossible burger for $6.51. It was well prepared very tasty. It's so tasty I kept checking if it was regular whopper. But it wasn't. How do I know? It was not greasy.
Cashier heard me well and I heard them well even though there was a lot of traffic. Very polite people and employees. Very busy crossing.

Definitely one of BEST restaurants in New Orleans.  Nina pulled this off and then some. The food is off the chain fab!  And, the cocktails are as balanced as they come. Abigail rocks and makes this place.  Try her Mai Tai. Best in town!

First time here, and while there are some definite positives and perks, there are also peeves and points lost. 
It enjoys a long history (35 years?) of putting out decent food, but while they go to the appreciated trouble of bringing warm bread, they serve the hot entr (the lemon salmon was delicious!) on room temp plates, and crisp, but not chilled salads.
Went for my wife's bday. Unbelievable food, great service! Had the bruschetta,  mussels, surf and turf and ribeye oscar style. Worth every penny, will go again for sure!
Shelby was such a nice help. The store has a good variety of stones and jewelry, definitely worth a visit.
Always incredible service friendly atmosphere and owner -and delicious food. The muscles margarita are my favorite.

If I ever end up on death row outside a state with no WC...... Six cheeseburgers, fries and a cream soda will be my last meal.

WC is the first stop after landing at IND and the last stop before gassing up the rental car for the return trip back to the A-T- L.

For the complainers it is what it is.  Sure service might be slow at times but the hot little sliders with melted cheese more than makes up for it.
Amazing sandwiches, large and filled with fresh and delicious ingredients. Very friendly service as well!
Go to place for an excellent meal.  Wide/varied/unique assortment of tasty appetizers.

Had a reservation for dinner here last night... My husband and I were going to the Merriam Theater and wanted to eat somewhere close by. EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING! The restaurant itself is beautiful. Our waiter was attentive, friendly, and had great recommendations on what to order. The food was incredible! Appetizers, entrees and deserts -- all delicious! Will definitely be back again for specials occasions!

I love Pei Wei, I've been coming for years and I don't remember being disappointed yet. Usually I pay a little more here than a normal 'Chinese' restaurant but it's soooo much better. The sushi is pretty good, too. I love the soup, tea and the chicken lettuce wraps. I have tried most of the entrees too. The only thing I wish they had one North of Nashville and had coupons!

Their delivery guy refused to drop off my order (even just at my hotel lobby) and expected me to find him in traffic.  What a joke this place is.  I tip the guy 20% and he expects me to run out into traffic to find him because he doesn't want to park, lol.

The Pisces Sushi experience is an exceptional value , Creative cuisine , casual atmosphere . 
Try Pisces on busy night or a slow night , you won't be disappointed

My coworkers and I came for lunch and were very impressed! Our company was selected as the Company of the Month; the lunch buffet was both quality cuisine and excellent value! I enjoyed a lovely soup, two small sandwiches, a delicious, fresh salad, and delightful dessert. Sierra was very attentive to our table - conversational and kind too. We will definitely return!

Tonight my family and I had a pleasant dinner at LaScala. We have dined here several times before so we are familiar with them.  It is open and can be noisy but I don't find it troublesome. We have tried many things on the menu and I have yet to get food I did not like. My husband loves the Stuffed Long hots, I like the Portobello (w/ crab) and Italian Wedding Soup. For an informal meal, get together with friends, BYOB, I recommend this place.

By far my favorite pizza ever!! I've had pizza all over the country and nothing compares.  Family owned and service is always GREAT!! The owner and chef is always there and he personally makes every pizza by hand.   Starting with a fresh ball of dough and fresh ingredients.  The only problem is that it is so popular there is most always a wait.  The times I've arrived before opening the line is already starting.  Always worth the wait!

Smelled great. Looks great!
Slow service. 
Food was average. BLT does not get cherry tomato on it!!
I would wait a while to go back!
TM

For a quick sandwich shop potbelly deserves 5 full stars ! The bread tastes freshly baked and gets deliciously crunchy and chewy after it goes thru the toaster . The set up is Quiznos style where you order the style wich and they get the meat and cheese then put it thru the toaster on a conveyor belt and another staff member does the veggies and dressings . I got an Italian and they were nice enough to add balsamic dressing on it for me even though it is for salads primarily . The hot peppers are a must ! They are fresh fresh fresh and not too spicy just delicious . Everything tastes high quality and for the regular sandwich with chips it was only 6$ and change . A great spot for a killer simple sub .

The charbroiled oysters are delicious! My girlfriend recommended Drago's for these delicacies! We were not disappointed, fresh and perfectly grilled. The melted butter is great for dip for the bread. We also tried the lunch menu choices of a cup of gumbo and Mediterranean crab salad. If I'm in NOLA, I'd go back for the charbroiled oysters!

Great bar....pretty much everything you could want a good bar.

The food is not spectacular but of average bar quality.  Mostly, the food consists of standard bar food, mostly deep fried goodness resembling nothing even a little healthy.  The drinks are well made, and the beer is cheap.  I can never argue with cheap booze...it always makes the bar experience that much better.  Also, I am a huge fan of the atmosphere.  The place is incredibly laid back, from the patrons to the workers, and they always make an effort to keep your drinks filled up.  

This is just like a neighborhood bar, and everyone who hangs out here generally seems like they have been hanging out here for years.  It's a nice place and a bar I really enjoy frequenting....

This place has the best location of all the restaurants in Clearwater Beach and is always crowded.  They have live music and is a good place to see the sunset on the beach.  

The food was okay.  I ordered battered shrimp and my husband ordered shrimp flat bread.  The flat bread might be the best thing they have for the price and taste.  Our waitress was attentive and fast. 

Overall it was an acceptable experience at this place.

so I have been popping into Old Pueblo Traders next to BevMo ever since I found some great Tevas there when they first opened. ever since then, it's been a bust (service-wise)! i go in while my husband is shopping next door and am NEVER greeted or asked if I need assistance. now, this would't be so bad *if* they did not 

a.) eye me suspiciously like I'm about to steal something
b.) help every blue hair in the store while making small talk with them.

i wonder if it's because i'm not a senior citizen? clearly, they are geared for a different demographic than I belong to, but us young whippersnappers aren't all that bad! c'mon, ladies, get those granny-panties unruffled and realize the elderly are not your only customers! while i wouldn't be caught dead in 90% of the clothing in this store, a portion of their shoe selection is worth checking out, especially if you're fond of brands like Clarks, Teva, Naturalizer, Grasshoppers etc. occasionally there are good things in the clearance shoes, too, and they quite often sell sales samples in the size range of 6-7, ladies.

Alas, a one star review for their grievous bias in service.
The best Hibachi on planet earth. Period. We're absolute fans and have (like many I'm sure) been to countless similar restaurants over the years. This is our absolute favorite, hands down.

I love this place!
So much variety! 
Fresh made pasta, hot bar & deli:)
Shared a hot Italian and a bottle of Pinot Gris with my guy!
Great food and great beer.  We were visiting from out of state.  We will now make this a stop every time we are in the area.
Excellent chicken and sides. Served hot and it's pretty quick after you order.  Waited about 25 minutes outside before ordering.

I received the most incredible bouquet prepared by one of your artists! It is beyond spectacular! The protea is such a beautiful center surrounded by the most unusual roses & opening lilies. Very gorgeous!

Liked the service and the cocktail. However, I will NEVER recommend this eatery to anyone. Why, you ask?  I do not like to be exploited. $27.00 for 4 bites of duck breast(granted it was delicious) with no sides is a poor value and unacceptable.

When I expressed my disappointment to the Manager, he could have cared less. The server, however, comped us a free dessert. I had already told her, prior to this complaint/suggestion, that her tip was going to be a FAT one due to her excellent service.

This was easily the highlight of our recent trip to New Orleans. Our tour guide was fun, knowledgeable, and easy to follow. We loved walking around the city at night and learning about the history. I wasn't expecting to enjoy the ghost tour as much as I did, but I would recommend it to anyone! 

The only bad part was the actual buying of the tickets. We stopped by throughout the day and no one was there at the ticket stand. When we arrived at the tour time, the woman siting there told us not to tell anyone that she wasn't there throughout the day. Then, she refused to take our credit card. Thank god we had cash. 

All in all, minus this minor mishap, check them out. Hopefully the woman who gave us so much trouble is no longer working here.

The Sail Pavilion serves as a great place to watch the sunset with a view of the water and harbor of downtown Tampa! Sail Pavilion can be a great stop for anyone biking, running, or walking the Tampa Bay Riverwalk.  This place is dog friendly with plenty of dog water bowls available so bring your furry friends! However, the service is terribly slow. Drink prices are a bit pricey at $5-7 per beer and $8-12 per mixed drink. They have a wide variety of tropical drinks including: the blue crush, pina colada, strawberry daquiri, rum runner, coco loco, mud slide, margarita, sex on the beach, mai tai, and mojito. I had the burger and shrimp wontons and they were both awful. They only have 1 waiter and 2 bartenders for the whole place.  I got tired of waiting and went up to the bar and that took over 10 minutes in a 4 deep line just to get a drink.  They need a better menu and more staff on the weekends. Especially if there is an event at the Convention Center. Sail Pavilion has food trucks almost every Friday and is a local crowd favorite gathering spot for residents of Downtown and Habour Island. Boaters can dock their boat at the marina in front of the restaurant, take a boat tour from the marina, rent water bikes, rent boats, and soak in pretty views of the boats in the marina, Jackson's Waterfront Bistro, Harbour Island, Davis Island, the Hillsborough River, and even Bayshore!

I've lived in Reno for two years and just found kimmies, I wish I'd of found it sooner.The service was Excellent the food was phenomanal all around I'd have to say best breakfast in Reno. Pegs used to be the favorite but kimmies is the best the biscuits and gravy was the best I've had the sausage was incredible please if you haven't been to kimmies treat yourself and enjoy an excellent meal!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Can't really complain when it comes to all you can eat steak! I particularly loved the well seasoned sirloin cuts. The sides they provide for you including the bread and the mash potatoes were also worth noting. Even my friend who dislikes cheese love the cheesy bread. But of course, it was quite an amazing experience when it came to the meats. There was just so much my stomach didn't quite know how to respond at times, so definitely do pace yourself. In terms of the salad bar they had, they had a nice selection of items that provided a refreshing cleanse throughout the meal. The oranges were particularly sweet and so my friends and I loaded up on those at the end HAHA.

First time in my life that I've been to a restaurant where you can bring in your own bottle of champagne to make mimosas! The food and staff were great! I'd love to go back the next time I'm in Philly.

Occasionally I get food that ends up being either expired or very close to their expiration date, but overall, the employees are helpful, produce is fresh most of the time, and I've only had to bring stuff back a couple times. Not to shabby.

The menu on their site is incorrect and not valid. They won't honor their advertised prices. Person taking the order didn't know the menu or ingredients/cook on the items. Asked to add jalapeos to a steak sub and was told they can't do that, yet they have a pizza with jalapeos on it ??!?.  Just moved to the area and won't be placing another order. $70+ for two sandwiches and two pizzas plus a delivery fee. Prior to hanging up was asked if I wanted to tip the driver on my credit card ?!?, how about deliver my food timely and warm and we'll consider a tip. Could have went to a chain restaurant and had a full course meal plus adult beverages for the price we just paid for a local restaurant. Get with the program OWNERS, you're batting zeros with your community.  

Food arrived as promised, but owners, come on now with your quality. You're using frozen pizza doughs and pre packaged ingredients. You're probably getting everything from Sysco and charging homemade prices. Lost a potential consistent customer with poor service and sub par food quality. Do you put effort into anything on your menu? It was like ordering baseball field food, in fact I've had better field food that what you delivered. 

Sorry, not sorry. You're in control of your business, quality and customer service.

We had no reservations but we're told it was a 20 minute wait. No problem . We went to the bar and when two seats opened up at the bar fairly quickly we decided we would at the bar instead. Food was absolutely amazing but bartender was horrible. No personality and no customer service skills. He had a friend sitting at the bar to whom he was giving drinks to "on the house". We asked him for extra shrimp bbq sauce and he said he couldn't do that. Never checked on us for refills on drinks.  The food however was fantastic just don't bother sitting at the bar. Rib eye and pork chops were out of this world.

It was a cryptic and memorable Friday night (in early April).

Walking down (dark and shady) Gaskill Street on my way to Marrakesh, I already felt as if I had been transported to sequestered residential alleyway in a Moroccan town. I kept looking back after we turned the corner because I literally thought that someone was following my friend and I. At last, we spotted the green Marrakesh awning and spotted some men chatting while grilling meats under the bright outdoor light. They instructed us to use the side entrance on Leithgow.

We knocked on the door twice. A few seconds later, somebody opened the door asking if we had a reservation. "No," I said. He let us in anyway.

We were seated immediately (because this place is TINY). Then, we realized two things: 1) that this place was cash only (which is always a huge turn-off), 2) that the only dinner option was a 7-course menu. We deliberated for a few seconds, and decided that we would stay for the adventure. I'm glad we did. 

My friend ran to the nearest ATM to get some cash. Meanwhile, I had already started digging into the first course before he returned. We still joke that we think we were already 50% full after just the first course. There's unlimited pita bread (throughout your meal, not just the first course; they actually encourage you to take a handful each time) and massive servings of very filling eggplant, mint/carrot and cucumber side dishes. I think the second dish was the olive chicken dish, which was so amazingly tender and well-flavored. If I recall correctly, that's the only course where you had the option to choose between two dishes.

A few minutes pass. Everything is kind of hazy in my mind after the second dish because we both gradually slipped into a massive and serious food coma. We literally just slouched there and thought "OMG... how much more do we have to eat. My stomach is literally about to explode." It's not like we could take it to-go. There was even a belly dancing performance somewhere in between. Desserts came and we breathed a sigh of relief.

Everything tasted really good. I've never had Moroccan food before this, but I get a feeling that everything tasted relatively authentic. Some of the textures and tastes are a little bizarre for the American palate (like the scrambled-egg like dessert). Nonetheless, it tasted good and that's all that really matters.

Here's some things to know before you come:
- It's cash-only. There's an ATM at the restaurant, but, of course, you never want to fall for that trap.
- Come with more than one other person! I saw two other groups that were just two people, but trust me, you will start to feel uncomfortable by the third or fourth course and it's not a pleasant feeling. And definitely don't come here alone. I would say 3-5 people is a good party size.
- Be prepared to eat with your hands. Utensils are not the norm here.
- The ambiance is wonderful. It's like a little piece of Morocco that made its way to Philadelphia. With that said, it can get kind of boisterous. 
- Service is great.
- Generally quite affordable. My friend and I ate like pigs and we still paid like $30 each. They also pre-calculate the gratuity for you, I think, so you just pay the amount that's on the check.

Made a reservation here for Saturday night after graduation. We were not prepared to seat 9 people at a bar table.. it was way too cramped for us and we were elbow to elbow..if they would have told me that was were we were to be seated I would not have made the reservation. 
Service was good at least
Food was okay.. Steak Frite was full of gristle and fat. Pasta was dry. Burgers were good, fries are soso.. most our food came out cold. We used to really like this place when we lived in Reno.

I was surprised to hear that this place had closed. Too cool for Edmonton. It's also a difficult balance for a cafe between making a place feel cosy enough to spend hours there, and having people actually buy 1 drink and spending hours there.

Amazing place for breakfast. Found it while walking in the area one morning. Has great big floor to ceiling windows to look at the street and square. Great food, price and very friendly staff. Can't ask for anything more. It filled up quickly, come early.

Gave 5 star burger a try after takin the 2&4 yr old niece & nephew to the magic house today.
(Sadly they didn't get 5 stars)
First the burger: Meat good quality beef and toppings. Topping were fresh and the fresh klausen type pickles as well as decent lettuce and tomato a nice touch. I ordered grilled onions which they agreed to add. While they were ok, those onions were obviously pre prepped whereas another place in the area does absolutely fab grilled onions upon order ie fresh (That place I gave x5 Stars)
The fries were a graded a solid C. They are not fresh cut but were indeed hot albeit brown in spots
Cheese Curds just to try. I honestly expected them to be better than say Culver's but were just ok.
For soft drinks 5 star burgers get props for using pure cane sugar soda products (not sure of brand? As waiter brings drinks) 
Didn't have room for Ice Cream although the Shakes I saw looked pretty good

Spot it usually spot on! Ordered 15 boneless wings half pineapple jalapeo and tajin. Waited almost 20 minutes for my order and when I got home my wings we're barely sauced and my the chicken was overcooked. Very disappointed and will highly recommend somewhere else if you want wings.

I used to love this place but not anymore. I have been waiting and waiting and waiting for my items and still only picked up 2 out of 10. Quite a few of my items have been shown online to be sitting at the DSW store in Cherry Hill since Saturday, but I still have not gotten the text message to come pick my stuff up and I really want my stuff. I will not be ordering online from DSW again, because the wait is just too much and I had no idea it could take so many days for them to say OK come get your stuff after reaching their store. When I went there Friday morning to pick up items (because online it said they were at the store but I never told me to come pick it up), the cashier was very helpful and found two of my items up front even though it didn't say to pick it up yet....she let me have them. That's why I'm like my stuff is sitting there and I'm not able to get them. That's not cool.

I had the best customer service experience here. Waiter (I believe his name was either Cody or Corey) was so kind and brought my 2 year-old son sticky rice while we waited for our food. (For those with toddlers, you understand that means the world) He checked on us constantly - our drinks never got empty. Food was great - complimentary edamame sealed the deal on our great experience. Plus, kids eat free on Sundays. Will be back again!

I've visited Granite City on a number of occasions and today was just ok. I had the buffalo chicken wrap with fries and a mango margarita.

The Buffalo Chicken Wrap had Crispy Chicken, Buffalo Sauce, Celery, and ranch dressing (I swapped that for the Bleu Cheese Dressing that it typically comes with) Tomatoes, and Lettuce.  The buffalo sauce was a bit overpowering for my taste. The next time I'll probably just ask for that on the side. I also got the natural cut fries with it and they were bland. They were hot and crisp, but didn't really have a flavor profile. 

The margarita was good. I would get that again. It was a nice balance of alcohol and sweetness.

Things to know:
1. This location is in the mall so you will most likely park underground and have to pay a small fee for parking (unless you happen to snag one of the few street level parking spots).
2. Remember your elevator or escalator so you don't lose your car.

I hate to give bad reviews, but I went in they sat me in my pedicure chair and left me there for 25 minutes. Which is fine I guess....no water, nothing. The kicker though, they started working on the person that came in after me. No thanks. I left.
I always have a hard time getting dip nails that aren't too thick for my small nail beds. They did a great job here.

I've been searching for a Charming Charlies in the area of Indianapolis. I love Charming Charlies because:
1) It is a fashion jewelry store! I lovethis stuff!
2) Not only do they sell jewelry but a lot of accessories too! I've been able to score some really cute items such like my pink leopard print iPad holder.
3) Selection: Charming Charlies has a great selection of items that will dress up your everyday outfits. But they also have huge section for prom or a big night out. They now have a section just dedicated in this location for little girls.
4) Sale: There's always a very big clearance area. This the clearance section was buy one get one free so I scored three pairs of earrings and two big necklaces for only just $12!

So as you see I probably can tell if my review that I get overly excited just walking into the place. Of course I love the store is always color code in a coordinated but I love that I can always find something that I can quickly add to my wardrobe at a decent price. I LOVE Charming Charlie's! I'll be back!!!!

The shop and people are crooks - I got a part for my car for 64.18 on October 28th and paid by credit card. Took the part to the mechanic and he told me that it was the wrong part. Took the part back to the shop in less than 30 minutes and returned it. The owner said he will credit my account back today. I checked the next day and he said he will get it done soon. I went to the shop 3 days later and he said he will get it done. After 2 weeks of checking for the refund it never came I disputed the charge with my credit card and he still contested and did not give my money back ....I learned after losing 64 dollars that this shop is unethical and is not to be trusted .................BEWARE this is not a shop that you can trust
Amazing service and perfectly prepared food. The plantains were wonderful along with shrimp, rice, croquettas and garlic sauce. We will definitely return!

Nice place, but the food isn't exceptional. Today, I had the chicken fajitas. Nothing special, for sure. This comes with rice and beans, but I don't eat rice, so they substituted a double portion of beans. The beans we're okay, but the chicken just didn't have a lot of flavor. I had to add a ton of salsa, which also wasn't spicy - just something to dump on top.

They do have pretty good carrots, which are a staple in Taco shops throughout the West. And the decor is nice. The staff is friendly, and this is one of the better Betos locations.

Two stars for the food and four for the ambiance. Average = three stars...
Here as part of a foodie tour. Brisket poboy sandwich is really good. They didn't provide water for the group though. Just empty carafes
Great bar, awesome staff and nice beer selection. And the food choices are among the best in south Philly. Plenty of friendly faces, such an awesome neighborhood bar.

I had the small white plate mild (and it still had a kick for my wimpy palate, I can't imagine the really hot). For my 2 sides I chose the red skinned potato salad and the black eyed pea dish. The chicken is really great, cooked perfectly, crispy on the outside while tender, juicy and flavorful inside!  The sides I selected were ok, I enjoyed the potato salad but it needed a bit more salt (was a little bland), I didn't love the black eye peas side...however if you are a fan of red bell peppers, green bell peppers, black eyed peas and vinegar you may enjoy it. We sat outside and the weather was perfect, I would absolutely come back for more chicken the next time I'm in Nashville.

Service was fast and on point. Menu is basic beignets and coffee so even if there is a line it moves very quickly. Luckily we went on a weekday and there was no line but still packed. The beignets were everything I had imagined. EVERYTHING!!! The consistency was perfect. Not too soft the right kind of thickness. It was a hot day so I had the iced cafe au lait. The perfect pastry.

This is one of my favorite places to go when I'm in St. Louis.  A pleasant surprise is that they remodeled the bar area since the last time I was there.  It looks very good.  I was there with a couple of buddies and we ordered the 50 wing plate with the standard Sybergs sauce.  We ordered the wings extra crispy since the crew I was with were wing experts  and our experience has taught us to be careful with undercooked wings.  Of course we've never had that problem here and the cook made them to perfection.  Between the three of us we devoured the entire plate.  I ordered a dinner salad which was much larger than I thought, so I wound up wasting it.  Overall it was a very good experience in the food was good as expected.  I would greatly recommend that you
Pretty good tacos, and the prices are hard to beat! If you're looking for an authentic taste this is your spot.

If it was possible to award this business NEGATIVE stars I would but I did not want to leave the rating blank to misinform anyone that this is a place you every want to give custom.  I am just off the line with Terri.  She is an absolutely deplorable business woman.  I purchased 5 hair removal treatments for my fianc's neck.  He is a long haul truck driver and has a fairly difficult schedule to manage.  Our first appointment was back in September - I am STILL trying to schedule a second appointment.  The process takes all of 5 minutes tops and somehow this ghost town of a spa is always booked for 3 months in advance.  I manage his schedule very tightly and so when she tells me that we missed an appointment without notification, I contested.  I offered to show her a copy of my phone bill proving that I left a vm, as the line is never answered by a live person.  Two phone calls later and she refuses to acknowledge the second appointment and continues to offer me dates 3 months out.  

Please DO NOT WAISTE YOUR MONEY or YOUR TIME with this business.  The owner is dishonest and lack rational. 

Rachel Brown

Driver Chris responded quickly and was so helpful and definitely put me at ease. Vehicle was loaded onto the tow truck and he even explained to me how and why the vehicle was secured. I was given detailed information on where the vehicle would be going and how to contact the company if any further was needed. Wonderful experience!

I saw it on Tock and checked Yelp. What? 5 star in STL????
Went there with my girls and we all love it!!!! Every thing is amazing! Best Japanese restaurant in this area. Every dish we ordered worth. I would highly recommend the shared pot of rice (hard to remember the name) because it's so authentic! All sashimi are sooo fresh. Will defiantly come back soon.

I've now come twice for lunch and find the food is very good. Being a person who sticks with what he likes, I found the Hot Chicken sandwich as delicious the 2nd time as the first. I have brought different people and two of them swear by the chicken sandwich with ghost pepper cheese. The fries are done well, and I wouldn't recommend the upgrade to fries fried in duck fat. They weren't bad at all, but I personally didn't find them worth the additional cost. 

They wait staff was friendly and helpful.

Somewhere in the span of time, going out to lunch jumped from 10 bucks to 20, but that's probably more of an age indicator. The Little Lamb is priced competitively with all nicer lunch choices. 

I'll go here again.
Love the renovation and the menu upgrade! Great service and amazing Carnitas Chilaquiles! I will be back with a posse.

Hot diggity!!!! Just as good as before!! AND there's a sign at the hostess stand now that reads "if you've parked behind another car please notify hostess." Making the best of a tricky parking situation. HOORAY!! 

Stopped in for an outstanding plate of Nacho Libre (we shared it and it was perfect!!), beers, margaritas and, of course, elote. 

A great go to for late lunch while all of the other Mexican joints are closed between lunch and dinner. Hell. This is a great go to for any time of day, regardless of what else is open!!

Mambos was an awesome experience.  We were on the 3rd level dining.  Our waitress was Patrica and she was an amazing waitress.  She was very friendly, funny and a genuine person.  The food and drinks that were suggested was true Cajun southern hospitality.  Definitely return to mambos.

Where to start? Ok, first off I gave them 5 stars simply because Yelp does not allow me to give more. This could easily be a 10 stars place.

Tried it today for the first time, we got the Gamberi di Buffalo (shrimp in hot sauce with blue cheese and celery) as an appetizer. The shrimps were cooked perfectly with just the right amount of breading, nice and spicy but without disabling your taste buds for hours. A wonderful appetizer.

As the main entree we opted for the 3 Cheese Pizza (they use REAL gorgonzola cheese and not some crumbled concoction of blue cheese and God knows what else like most other places do, if they even offer something in the likes). The pizza was excellent, ultra thin like a real pizza is supposed to be (very italian style), nicely cooked with a nice crisp crust and a blackened out bottom (it's not burned, just the way a pizza is meant to be if cooked at the right temperature). No overpowering flavors, the cheeses perfectly blend in with each other making it one of the most mouth watering pie in the area.

Needless to say the whole pie (large) was consumed at the table, no leftovers for my dinner with this one, and trust me....it is difficult not to finish their Pizza. 

Delicate yet bold in flavor, and does not leave you with that bloated feeling after consuming it.

Overal was a wonderful experience, my taste buds are still dancing with joy. 

Definitely a keeper and won't be long before we go back for another pizza and to try some of the other entree they provide on their well assorted menu.

Staff was friendly, service was fast and spot on.

Oh did I mention their bread? A new take on the usually boring garlic knots offered by pizza parlors. And a successful take shall I say, nicely flavored, soft and moist to the point I could just go there and eat that for lunch and be satisfied.

Great little gem of a place.

I like whole foods, but not this one. Many of the products that I HAVE to go to Whole Foods for (vegan stuff, frozen burritos, quick dinners from the deli) do not exist at the Metairie location. 

I stopped in last night because I had a lull between classes, and found myself becoming frustrated with the lack of appetizing items on their hot bar OR their deli area.

The staff are excellent and will wander around the store with me while we both try to figure out what the hell a weirdo ingredient is and where to find it. I like this kind of customer service. The guy who works in the vitamin aisle is brilliant as well. He will explain what each product does and try to get you the best product for your bucks. 

TIP: park in the side lot! Nobody is ever parked there, and it's not a death trap like the main parking lot. I hate hitting pedestrians, it ruins my day.

The margaritas and mojitos were excellent. The food is good is okay but very over priced and small portions. I was excited by the house made chorizo, but it lacked spices and heat. I was pretty disappointed overall.
First time here! Love the view and music. (Sits right on the beach)Had the gator bites, they were delicious! Will be coming here again

I just encountered the rudest salesperson when I called this location. He told me he couldn't help with my request and then basically hung up on me. I will definitely not be shopping in this location again.

Awesome bow tie on the server!

The ambiance is awesome! Low lights, interesting menus on chalk boards exposed brick, etc...

Starter plate of cheeses was AWESOME! A nice and simple blend... not too much of anything. The wine suggestions were also pretty nice!

Wasn't blown away by the dinners but maybe they are more of meat place.

What a cool speak easy brewery, since we have found them we love going there. The staff is amazing and its not over the top, Shovel Buddy is my fav, there is always something going on and they support local, if you get a chance come a great brewery. I have never left here dis appointed,

One week past our one year original warranty on a brand new home and the a/c stopped working.  Have a premium service warranty with them.  Called for service and they would not send out a technician until Tuesday.  Called an a/c service we used at our previous residence and got service right away. Worst customer service ever. Needless to say, they have lost our business.

If you have never had a deep dish Chicago pizza this is the place to go. It was delicious.  We arrived just about 1 pm and it was still busy with a lunch crowd. Our group of 7 had a 10 minute wait which was not bad. Our server Jayden was very attentive. Their menu had 3 types of pizza. Chicago style, thin crust or extra thin crust. We decided the Chicago was the best choice. 3 of us split a small which is 6 slices and plenty for each. If you are limited on time it takes about 45 minutes for the deep dish! Beer selection was good. No room for dessert. Would definitely recommend.

Tried this place for the first time tonight through a delivery app. It arrived burnt and cold. The bottom  was black and the cheese was super dark like it had been sitting under a heating lamp for hours. I couldn't even eat it. Also paid for a drink and didn't get it. That's partially my drivers fault for not checking. Overall a bad experience and I won't be eating here again
